loans.name: Mrs. Chen Chantha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people from Kdei Ta Hok village, Takeo province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Chen C. is 40 years old. She's become the village bank president selected by the other members, each of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sao Phoung, are farmers who own a 1.3-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is also selling mosquito nets and blankets door-to-door, while her husband is raising ducks and chickens at home. 

Today, she wants to expand her husband’s poultry-raising business, but she does not have enough money. So to improve this goal, Mrs. Chen C. is requesting for a loan from AMK to buy chicken and duck food. She has two children who are in school.

loans.use: To buy chicken and duck food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a shop

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene la edad de 24 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos de 1 y otro de 4 meses de edad que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar 2 vacas para engordar. Cuenta con el terreno con pasto para el cuido de los animales por lo cuál invirtirá en la compra de animales para tener una ayuda extra. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Desea llegar a obtener una buena ganancia de los animales comprados para tener una ayuda extra en momentos deficiles. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y esta muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children.  One is a year old, the other 3 months old, and they are her top priority.  She would like to buy 2 cows to fatten.  She has land with grass for tending to animals, which is an extra help.  She has dedicated herself to her farm for several years, and would like to expand.  She would like to get to earning a good profit from her purchased animals, so that she has support in tough times.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR, and she is very happy to have the opportunity they provide for her. In the future, she would like to provide a higher standard of living and more financial stability for her family.  She would also like to continue growing both as a person and producer.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chenda B. is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Thai is 31 years old. They have been married since 2004 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. One of them is in school and the two others are still young and stay at home. The family lives along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chenda and her husband are farmers. They grow cauliflower on their farmland in the village and sell their products to a middleman who comes to buy them at their home. The couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their cauliflower farm. 

Hence Chenda is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide her capital. 

Note: In the photo the couple are at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To use for farming

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rocio del Pilar; tiene 30 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y también es propietaria de un hotel en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Lideres (The Leaders) communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac part of the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Rocio del Pilar, she is 30 years old and lives with her partner and has 2 children. The member alternates her day-to-day activities with the business of selling clothing she also owns a hotel in the city of Puerto Maldonado. The member through these small businesses has been able to give her children a good start in life and she wishes to improve her business. The member needs the loan to buy clothing like pants, shirts, sweaters and polos.

Mrs. Rocio is thankful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is committed to meet the payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy clothing like pants, shirts, sweaters and polos.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years-old and married with two children aged between three and five years-old.  Rose is a business woman and her husband works in the government.  She owns a interior decor shop at Remera called Smart Decor Shop Ltd.  She has been in the business of selling decorative items for the home for three years and she currently employs two people. She works from 7am to 8pm during the week and her shop is very well organised.

Rose is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more traditional handicrafts to sell which will allow her to improve her profits. She would like to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase traditional handicrafts and other decor items.

loans.name: Dashjargal

texts.en: Dashjargal D. is 57 years old and lives with his wife, daughter, and grandchild in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter has worked for a press company since graduating from university, and his grandson attends a local secondary school. Dashjargal operates an iron-crafting business where he produces a variety of chimney, stovepipe, fence, steel door, truck trailer and other metal items. Before starting this business, Dashjargal worked as a driver in a local mine. He has also operated a car-repair center for several years. He plans to buy a new truck to transport his iron products to customers located in the countryside. In the future, he hopes to expand the business and build a house and a fence for his family. Dashjargal is requesting a loan for 700,000 MNT to buy the tools and supplies he needs for his iron craft business.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for his business

loans.name: Phoeurk

texts.en: Mr. Phoeurk N. is a villager in Kdei Ta Hok village in Takeo province. He was born in 1975. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Yoem Kung, sells fruit in the local market and is able to earn some money to support the family. Mr. Phoeurk N. has some problems with the plantation because his field has infertile soil and it is far away from an irrigation system. So, to improve production, Mr. Phoeurk N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide. He is the father of three children: two of whom are studying in the local public school while the other is too young to work or study. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Maclina Nduku

texts.en: Maclina, 50 years old, is married to Joel. She has five children aged between 18 and 29 years old. Maclina has been farming for the past four years with an income of about KES 25,000 per month. She has a good history with KADET, and this is her third loan, after having successfully repaid the previous ones. She wants to use the loan amount to buy farm tools and materials to build a small farm house. She hopes to grow different varieties of crops.

loans.use: to buy farm tools  and materials to build a small farm house

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Salimata T. est une femme mariée de 43 ans et mère de 4 enfants (3 garçons et 1 fille). Elle vit avec son époux  dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Fama, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Salimata T. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à la fabrique des savons traditionnels (savons noirs) il y a environ six années qu’elle a appris auprès d’une voisine. Elle mène son activité à son domicile de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 3 années avec laquelle elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 16 futs de déchets d’huile de coton (pâtes noires), 8 sacs de soude caustique et 4 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe. Après fabrication des savons à base de déchets d’huile de coton et de soude caustique, elle les revend en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes de sa localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 240 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Salimata T., aged 43, is a married women and the mother of four children (three boys and a girl).  She lives with her husband in a large traditional family in Fama, the downtown of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, Salimata became familiarized with making traditional soaps (black soap) about six years ago.  She learned this trade from a neighbor and operates out of her home in Sikasso, where she is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her products.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Salimata decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over three years ago and is now on her fifth individual loan.  The previous loans have all been properly repaid.  With this new loan, she intends to buy 16 barrels of waste cotton oil (black paste), 8 sacks of caustic soda, and 4 cart loads of firewood.  After making the soap from the waste cotton oil and caustic soda, she sells it retail to a customer base composed generally of women in her town.

With this loan, Salimata envisions making a monthly profit of 240,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for increasing her working capital, helping to cover family expenses, and paying the loan interest.

loans.use: Buying waste cotton oil and caustic soda

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata S. is a widowed lady with five children between the ages of 22 and 6. Her business is located at Shisejeri market in Kakamega near Eregi College. Kakamega is the western region of Kenya and is well known for its large-scale production of sugarcane and is known as the sugar belt region. She owns a general store in which she sells items such as sugar, salt, cooking fat, blankets, bags, and other items to the local people and the students of Eregi College. She has been in this business for the last 15 years now and has managed to provide employment to three people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to increase her stock of general items to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, open a hardware store. She describes herself as focused, energetic, intelligent, and outgoing.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, blankets, and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase braids and oil for the hair

loans.name: Mican

texts.en:
Mican is a member of Chitosan group under Faulu Kenya.  He joined the group after he was introduced by a friend.  Since then, his business where he sells health-related products has improved.  He has been running his business for two years.  He was previously selling drinks and doing farming.  

Being a married man with two children, he works hard at his business so as to provide for his family.  He hopes to open more outlets for his business.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more health-related products.

loans.use: To buy more health-related products.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia se dedica a la venta de medicina natural. Hace más de 27 años que tiene este negocio. Siempre está pensando en mejorar su negocio cada día y es por medio de los financiamientos que lo ha logrado poco a poco. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante, su forma de ofrecerlos es abordando diferentes buses que conducen a los diferentes departamentos y así logra obtener clientes nuevos y estables. Actualmente está solicitando este crédito para la compra de vitaminas, ungüentos, suplementos, frascos, hierbas entre otros.
texts.en: Alicia's business is selling natural medicines.  She has been in this business for more than 27 years and is always planning to improve her business every day.  Through taking loans, she has gradually achieved this.  Alicia gets up very early as she sells her products as an itinerant vendor.  Her way of selling involves taking different buses to different departments and obtaining new and regular customers.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy vitamins, olntments, supplements, small bottles and herbs etc.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, ointments, supplements, small bottles, herbs, etc.

loans.name: Narcisa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Narcisa, es originaria de la comarca Chilamatillo ubicada en la comunidad Miraflor – Estelí, tiene 61 años de edad, esta casada, es agricultora y ama de casa también, tiene un hijo, se dedica a sembrar papas, ella lleva 4 años en esta actividad. Inicio con esfuerzos propios sembrando papas, ella se vio motivada al ver a su marido que sembraba hortalizas. Ella también se ha dedicado a la ganadería en esta actividad lleva 20 años comenzó comprando una vaca y luego dos mas hasta lograr tener su propio ganado ,gracias a eso también ha podido sobrevivir , se dedica también a vender gallinas , tiene una pulpería, ha sabido ser una mujer de progresos a pesar de que no sabe leer ni escribir , no pudo aprender pues sus padres no le pudieron pagar estudios ya que eraN muy pobres, eran 10 hermanos y solo tenían para medio comer no le ajustaba para ponerlos a estudiar desde entonces ella se ha dedicado a trabajar. Se caso a los 16 años de edad pero trabajaba en las labores domesticas y del campo.
Solicita el préstamo para sembrar ¼ de manzana cultivo de papas, comprar semillas, insumos. Con esta inversión espera sacar una buena cosecha de papas, con calidad, desea poder ampliar su siembra, mejorar sus ingresos.
Tiene como planes futuros poder sembrar una manzana de papas, surtir de más productos nuevos su pulpería, tener en buenas condiciones su ganado y ser una persona auto sostenible, ahorrar para su retiro.
texts.en: Narcisa is originally from Chilamatillo area of the Miraflor-Estelí community. She is 61 years old, married, and is a farmer and housewife. She has a son, and has grown potatoes for 4 years. She began on her own growing potatoes, inspired by her husband who was growing crops. She also has raised livestock for 20 years, beginning with a cow and then adding two more until she had her own herd. Thanks to this work she has been able to survive. She also sells chickens, has a convenience store, and has known how to be a successful woman even though she doesn’t know how to read or write. She couldn’t learn how to read or write as her parents couldn’t pay for school as they were very poor; there were 10 children and they only had enough to eat which didn’t leave any money left over for school so she has always worked. She married at the age of 16 and has worked as a domestic employee and in the field. She seeks a loan to plant ¼ manzana (1 acre = .57 manzana) of potatoes, buy seeds, and supplies. With this investment she hopes to have a good harvest of quality potatoes. She hopes to be able to expand her planting thus improving her income. She has future plans to plan one manzana of potatoes, stock more new products in her store, and have good conditions for her cattle and be a self-sufficient person, saving for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, and plant potatoes

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA constitué de cinq femmes : 4 veuves et 1 mariée, ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 2 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de draps de lit, de pagnes et des fruits et légumes tels les oranges avec ROKIA D.. 
ROKIA D.  compte acheter avec son  prêt 50 chargements de charrette en orange. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de MEDINE .
Les oranges sont revendus au  marché de HAMDALLAYE et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA, qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The DANAYA group has five women members : 4 widows and 1 married woman whose average age is 40. They have two children and mostly live in polygamous families in Medine, a neighborhood in the city of Sikasso which is the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their seventh round of borrowing with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clients. All their previous loans have been repaid without any problems. The group of women is in the business of selling bed sheets, cloth skirts, fruits and vegetables, for example oranges.

With the loan, one of the members, ROKIA D. plans to purchase 50 cart loads of oranges.
She will purchase her supplies at the market in Medine. The oranges are then sold at the HAMDALLAYE market and to families with men and women as clients who pay in cash.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 cfa francs which will be used to pay for daily family expenses. She hopes to increase her turnover so she can better serve her clients.

loans.use: to purchase oranges

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh Group

texts.fr: JEHOVAH JIREH est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo) est nommée Ahoèfa Honorine. Les membres du groupe se connaissent compte tenu du fait qu’ils habitent dans la même zone au Benin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1980 au Togo, Ahoèfa Honorine vit depuis environs deux ans dans sa zone au Benin. Ahoèfa Honorine est mariée à un agent commercial nommé Franck et a quatre enfants. Certains parmi les enfants sont scolarisés, mais tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leur parents à Ekpè. Le couple se partage les diverses charges familiales. Afin d’assurer un mieux être à ses enfants, Ahoèfa Honorine vend depuis cinq ans, des tissus de façon ambulante. Ahoèfa Honorine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Ahoèfa Honorine et son groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Ce prêt permettra certainement à Ahoèfa Honorine et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité par l’augmentation du stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: Jehovah Jireh is a group made up of three people, the president (the one with the hand raised in the photo) is called Ahoèfa Honorine. The members of the group know each other for they live in the same neighbourhood in Benin. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group requests a loan through ALIDé.Born in 1980 in Togo, Ahoèfa Honorine has lived in Ekpè for about two years. She is married to a commercial agent called Franck and has four children. Some of the children go to school, but all the children live together with their parents in Benin. The couple share the various family expenses. In order to guarantee greater welfare for her children, for the last five years Ahoèfa Honorine has been selling fabrics on a mobile basis. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is the first request for a loan through ALIDé by Ahoèfa Honorine and her group .This credit will undoubtedly allow Ahoèfa Honorine and her group to raise the level of their activity by increasing the stock of their products, to enlarge their clientele and their income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Hariet

texts.en:
Hariet is 36 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  Hariet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been running this business for 13 years.  She also earns income from a piggery and a rice mill.   

Hariet has requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell, such as sardines and other grocery items.  She has successfully repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy stocks to sell

loans.name: Wolale Bamana 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE BAMANA 3 est formé de 10 femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la préfecture de San, région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 39 ans et au moins 5  enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide du fonio et du sésame.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après correctement remboursé  les  prêts elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
KONIMBA, qui est la première debout à gauche en robe blanchâtre, compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, des semences de fonio et d’arachide,  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles  pour la culture,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 15000 à 69.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wolale Bamana 3 group consists of ten married women from the village of Cinzara in the San prefecture of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and are on average 39 years old with at least five children.

They grow peanuts, fonio (a West-African cereal) and sesame. To make their crop-farming profitable, group members decided three years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. Having successfully repaid previous loans, they are now on their third agricultural loan cycle.

Konimba, who is the first standing on the left wearing an off-white dress, wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fonio seeds and peanuts for planting, small farming equipment and agricultural inputs for crop-growing, from the general market in San.

After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while so that they can gain value before being resold at the general market in San, Dah and in surrounding markets, mostly retail (often in bulk) against cash to a customer base coming from large towns.

After selling their agricultural products each member of the group hopes to achieve profits between 15,000 and 69,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interests and cover ongoing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a goat meat business, buying and selling goats. She sells at wholesale to her neighbors and butcher shop operators. Salama faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more goats to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 58 years old and widowed with 6 children.

Salome works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

Salome has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (restaurant).

Salome aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: In the photograph, Esi is showing the corn dough she uses to prepare the kenkey she sells. She is married and stays with her three children. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to support her partner in feeding and clothing her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase maize to expand her kenkey business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest for further growth of the business.

loans.use: to purchase maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Herson Enoc

texts.es:
Herson, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos quienes dependen económicamente de él. Herson inicio la agricultura desde joven cuando ayudaba a su padre a realizar las labores agrícolas, no tiene un horario establecido.
Por el momento está sembrando maíz, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar abono para aplicarlos al cultivo, con este insumo estará preparado para que su plantación sea fuerte y le dé buena cosecha. 
Su objetivo es ser un agricultor con buenas cosechas, que le permitan comercializarlas a buen precio, también pueda cubrir la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Herson is a farmer.  He lives with his wife.  They have two children who are financially dependent on him.  Herson began farming when he was young and would help his father with the farm work.  He does not keep a set schedule.
Herson is currently growing corn.  He is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer to apply to the crop.  With the fertilizer, he will be preparing his field to be strong and to give a good harvest.
Herson's goal it to be a farmer with good harvests that allow him to sell his crop at a good price and also to cover the cost of feeding his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 53 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with 5 children.

Flordeliza works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested loan to purchase 2 boxes of fish .
Flordeliza has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 boxes of fish

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  He is married and has 1 child who is not currently in school.  Sam has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar and soap, which he has had for 4 years.         

To help expand his business, Sam has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sam hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family.  In the future, Sam hopes to expand his business. 

Sam is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: buy sugar and soap

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
Ganhuyag is 27 years old and lives with his wife and  son in a ger—a Mongolian yurt— in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife has worked as an accountant at the local eldercare house for two years. 

He started to fix cars and trucks at Khaan Auto Body Shop in 2005 and has worked there ever since. He has many years of business and practical experience and is a diligent and hard-working man. He says "I want to have my own auto body shop. Since my wife is working and my son is attending kindergarten, I am ready to start my business. I will work hard." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts and equipment for the business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and equipment for his business.

loans.name: Teofanes

texts.en:
Teofanes is a 41-year-old married woman who has a fish selling business in Panglao, Bohol. This business has been running for 10 years.

Teofanes buys the fish she sells from fishermen in her town. She works hard to improve her income and support her family. She requested this loan to buy an ice box, a weighing scale, and more fish to sell. Teofanes hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an ice box, a weighing scale and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is married to a civil servant and they have four children aged seven to fifteen. Flora sells cosmetics, lotions, and hair products. She also braids hair in her shop. She has been running this business for five years. The business has enabled her to send her children to school. Flora needs a loan in order to buy more cosmetics in order to make more profits. With her savings and profits she would like to open her own hair salon.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira has operated her food café business for four years; an idea that she had to help bring up her family. She is separated from her husband and has three children under her care. They are ages 16, 10 and 3 and a half. All of them are in school. Subira lives in the Malindi area of Coastal Province, Kenya. She operates her business at the roadside and has a good number of rural folk as her clients. Her main challenges arise during low season when sales volumes get low.

Subira has been a Milango client for three months. She will use this loan to buy flour, sugar and other cereal foodstuffs for her business. She has no other source of income and has set her eyes on venturing into a clothes business in the future. This loan will help her supply her family’s basic needs and educate her children. She is grateful to Milango for providing her with the credit.

loans.use: to buy stock of additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El socio se dedica  a la elaboración de tortas, panes, pasteles, y en esta ocasión preparara la maza y todos los últimos retoques de las famosas muñecas gua guas, los panes en forma de bebes envueltas con caritas de ceramica y con decoración de grageas, confites en todo el cuerpo para las ñiñas y para los niños los famosos caballos hechos en pan con la carita de caballos en ceramica, estas fiestas de todos los santos se celebra en todas las casa en especial del Cusco con panes guaguas que es una palabra quechua que significa pan  bebe y todas las familias tradicionales que tienen en casa una nena compran las nuñecas hechas en pan y los que tienen varones menores en casa compran caballitos de pan que se los pueden comer. El socio no ajenoa  a estas costumbres desea invertir el credito para la compra de harina, levadura, confites, caritas entre otros ingredientes.
texts.en: Edgar has a business making cakes, breads and pastries.  This time of year, he will prepare the dough and all of the finishing touches for the famous "gua gua" bread dolls.  These are breads made into the form of babies, and they are wrapped around little ceramic faces and decorated all over with sprinkles and candy.  These bread dolls are made for little girls, and for the boys he makes bread dolls in the form of horses with little ceramic horse faces.  The All Saints holidays are celebrated in every home, especially in Cusco, with the gua gua breads.  The name comes from a Quechua word that means "bread baby," and all of the traditional families that have a little girl in the house buy the dolls made of bread, and those that have young boys in the house buy the little horse breads so that the children can eat them.  Edgar is familiar with these customs, and he wants to invest the loan in the purchase of flour, yeast, candies, little ceramic faces, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, candies, little ceramic faces and other ingredients

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 10 children. 

Rosita works in the fishing industry and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 33 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat. Rosita has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Bahati has operated a vegetable grocery for the past two years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of vegetables like tomatoes and onions for her grocery. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of vegetables like tomatoes and onions for her grocery.

loans.name: Narangarav

texts.en:
Narangarav is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her family in outer ger district without the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She has three children, ages 4 months to 14 years, and her elder two children attend local secondary school.

Narangarav has been working at a pet shop since 2009, and currently she looks after her newborn baby. Her husband works as a machinist at a local company. The family lives in an old small house, in which they have been doing some renovation work. They haven’t finished their renovation work yet; today Narangarav needs some bricks, wood, and other essential materials to finish her housing work. Therefore, she is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian Tughrik (MNT) loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Kikundi Cha Wilima Mbinga Mjini Group

texts.en:
Filbeth is 45 years old and the father of four children.  One child attends secondary school and the other three attend primary school.  He has been growing maize and beans on his four acres of land for over three years.  He faces a number of problems including the lack of fertilizer and insecticide for his crops.

Filbeth is requesting a loan in order to increase his working capital and purchase fertilizer and insecticide.  With the revenue generated from this loan he plans to pay school fees for his children and build a good house.   And, in five years time, he hopes to expand his acres under production to 12 from four.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s animal feed business.

With the loan investment, Shameem's husband will purchase animal feed in larger quantities that will allow him to sell more and earn higher profits. He lives in the city that is famous for its' agricultural industry and most people there are associated with the farming and livestock profession. Animal feed is a high demand product.

Shameem is very supportive and sews clothes for her neighboring clients to financially support her husband. She has given birth to 4 children, all of whom are enrolled in the local school and getting their education. Shameem is hopeful that an investment will help her husband earn better income for the family and she will be able to continue providing education to her children.

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah passbook) is Shameem.”

loans.use: to buy animal feed for an animal feed-selling business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 24 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos y su pareja Richard de 25 años de edad, quien apoya para que puedan sobresalir adelante. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Vilma abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida de productos de primera necesidad tales como arroz, leche, variedad de cereales y menestras ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos más consumidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su entorno vecinal, lleva 02 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el lapso del día. Vilma solicita el crédito para poder comprar  lo necesario para su bodega. Para el bien de sus ingresos económicos más adelante espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para poder vender más productos. Este será su crédito numero 01 con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y está segura que contara con el apoyo de todos ustedes. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará más sacos de arroz, azúcar conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 24 years old. She is a working woman and lives in her own house with her 2 darling children and her partner, Richard, who is 25 years old, and who supports her so they can excel in the future. Every day, very early in the morning, Vilma opens her grocery store in order to tend to her neighbors. She is a very skillful saleslady; she knows how to treat her clients and always finishes up by convincing them to buy something more.

Her store is very well supplied with staples such as rice, milk, and a variety of grains and beans, and she is always worrying to buy the products most used. 

What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers and learning about the things going on in her surrounding neighborhood. She has been doing this for 2 years and what she considers the most difficult is to have to be on her feet all day long.

Vilma is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy what is necessary for her store. In order to have financial income going forward she is hoping to expand the facilities of her store in order to be able to sell more products. 

This will be her first loan with MFP, and she declares that the money from the loan will help her a lot in the progress of her work and she is certain that she can count on the support of all of you. With the 1000 soles she will buy bags of rice, sugar, preserved food and other items.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, sugar, preserved food, and milk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 32 years old. She married to a motorcyclist. They have three children; two of them go to school. She sells milk and cooked cassava and she has been running this business for the past ten years. She has requested the loan to buy more milk and cooked cassava to sell. With the profits from this business she will establish a store to sell beverages. She would love to see her business prospering in the future.

loans.use: To buy more milk and cooked cassava to sell.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian is a good boy and a student in Bina Negara Vocational High School. he come from Warung Kondang.
And his come from poor family, because her father just a Labor and his mother just a house wife. and of course he lack by costs for school. but when that's situation komida come and help her trouble about costs.
so thank's to komida and thank's to KIVA.

loans.use: To Pay monthly school costs

loans.name: Agbowongbé

texts.en:
Mrs. Agbowongbé A. was born in 1953 in Boko-Kutimé (P'Vo). She is married and the mother of six children. Her business is going well, but the burden of her family's needs does not allow her to use the profit margin to build up the business. She is very kind, highly esteemed and well-loved in her community. She has shown good credit management skills by fully reimbursing her two previous loans. She is a trustworthy woman who deserves to have financial support for the business that she manages so well.

Mrs. A. is asking for a new loan of $750 for the purchase of essential goods such as vegetables, which are in high demand. This will allow her to yield substantial revenue for her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Agbowongbé est née en 1953 à Boko-Kutimé (P'Vo). Elle est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Ses activités marchent bien mais le poids de la famille fait que sa marge bénéficiaire ne lui permet pas de constituer un fonds de commerce consistant. Très gentille, elle est bien appréciée et aimée dans son quartier. Elle a fait preuve d’une bonne gestionnaire à travers ses deux crédits obtenus et bien remboursés. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenu financièrement dans ses activités qu’elle maîtrise assez bien.

Madame A. sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $750 pour achet les produits de premières nécessités surtout les légumineuses bien demandées. Ce faisant, elle dégagera un revenu substantiel au besoin de sa famille

loans.use: to purchase essential goods such as vegetables

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia I. is 52 years old woman who leanrt her trade business for the past 6 yuears. She is happily married with three (3) children. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for processing

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
S. Mustafa Mammad Oglu is a businessman from Beyler village of the Saatli region. He has a bakery business. He produces bread and it is the only product he has but he would like to satisfy clients' demand for sweets. He has many orders for sweet products but his limited working capital doesn’t allow him to satisfy this need. 
He decided to meet this demand by receiving credit. He applied for 700 USD credit to “Agroinvest” Credit Union. His money will support  him in diversifying his products.

loans.use: He will use this credit to meet the demands of his clients and bake sweet products

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 43 years old. Her husband Santiago V. sells perfume for a living. They have three sons who attend a private high school. Ten years ago, Norma left her family and emigrated to Argentina to work. She worked as a domestic and sent money back to her husband to care for the children. In her free time, she studied hairdressing, and after several years of hard work she returned to Paraguay and used her savings to open her own hair salon. Today, her business is thriving, thanks to her own hard work and previous loans from Fundación Paraguaya. Norma is proud of her loyal customer base. At this point she is asking for a loan of $400 in order to renovate and paint the salon.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Norma, tiene 43 años D. edad, está casada con el Señor Santiago V. que se dedica a la venta D. perfumes; tienen tres hijos varones, los tres están cursan sus estudios secundarios en un colegio privado D. la ciudad. Norma nos cuenta que hace 10 años atrás tuvo que abandonar su familia y emigra a la Argentina (país limítrofe) en busca D. mejores oportunidades D. trabajo. Allá trabajo como empleada doméstica y enviaba dinero para ayudar a su marido que quedo a cargo D. los niños. En sus horas libres, Norma, estudió peluquería, y luego D. unos años D. arduo trabajo junto unos ahorros y volvió a su casa para abrir su propia peluquería. Hoy día, y gracias a su esfuerzo y créditos obtenidos en la Fundación, ella ha podido ver progresar su negocio. Posee una buena clientela formada, y está deseosa D. seguir progresando; ahora está pensando en mejorar la infraestructura D. su peluquería, para ello solicita un crédito D. $ 400 que lo utilizará para pintar y refaccionar su salón.

loans.use: To paint and renovate a hair salon.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco F. Rojas is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and seven year old child. His wife is a teacher and also contributes to the household income.

As a young man, Francisco started up his own Microenterprise by acquiring a vehicle and working as a driver. Several years later, he sold the vehicle and had the opportunity to buy both a new automobile and a taxi station. His business has done very very well, aided by the fact that Francisco always keeps his vehicles in good condition. Furthermore, he consistently guarantees his clients safe and comfortable trips to their destination.

Francisco will use his credit to make repairs caused by daily wear and tear on his taxi. He plans to repaint, reupholster, and repair the motor.

loans.use: Motor repair of borrower`s vehicle

loans.name: Eduarda Flores

texts.en:
Eduarda, 47, has been happily married for 20 years. Seven children (six boys and one girl) have resulted from this union. The children are grown up and are studying at the university and working. Eduarda dedicates herself to the fabrication and the sale of mosquito nets and tablecloths. In her community, lots of mosquitoes swarm and are causative agents of dengue disease. The entrepreneur sells the nets not only in her community, but also in Santo Domingo, the capital, where dengue disease is very frequent.

Eduarda has requested a loan to invest in the purchase of a quintal (approximately 100 pounds) of cloth so that she can continue producing her mosquito nets and the tablecloths. With a quintal of cloth, she usually makes 50 mosquito nets, and it takes about fifteen days to have them ready. That quantity of nets can be sold in four weeks, and the entrepreneur makes a weekly profit of USD 40 from the sale of her products.

This loan will help this assiduous woman keep on contributing to the well-being of many families in her community and other parts of the country and vastly improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy cloth so she can continue producing and selling mosquito nets and tablecloths.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: I am Parveen A.. I am married and a mother of five: three girls and two boys. I live with my family in Raiwind, a small town in Pakistan. At present, only my eldest daughter attends school while the others are small. I embroider clothes on order from my neighborhood clients. I wish to expand my business and buy an embroidery machine for this purpose. Please lend me $250. I hope to secure a sound economic and promising future for my family.

loans.use: Buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Nabulezi A Group

texts.en: Peace K. is married and has four children. She helps support her family by selling fruits and vegetables in her town's local market. Peace also leads a group of five women who have applied for a loan to buy more produce to sell to their customers and to start a carpentry workshop.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell and to open a carpentry business

loans.name: Domingos Francisco

texts.pt:
Domingos T. Xavier, born in Matola in 1933, was raised by his parents, who sent him to seminary in 1950. He is a pastor and father of fifteen children.

In 1956 he began to work for CFM (Mozambique Ports and Railways) until 1990, at the height of its reform. Since then he has dedicated himself to his business and to raising ducks for sale.

He learned to know HLUVUKU through an employee, through whom he approached and asked for his first credit in 2007.

With the proceedings from his business, he plans to support his dependents and provide for his family's education.

With this loan he plans to increase the volume of merchandise, and buy more ducks to raise and resell.

In the future, he plans to set up a gas pump to supply the neighborhood of Chinonanquila.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Localização: Bairro Chinonanquila, Boane

Cliente : Domingos T. Xavier

Actividade: Comercio

Montante:15.000,00mt ( 628 USD )

Aplicação : Compra de produtos para a revenda

Inicio: 28-01-08

Fim: 22-05-09

Domingos T. Xavier, nasceu em 1933 na Matola, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus pais os quais o encaminharam ao seminário em 1950 e é pastor e pai de 15 filhos.

Em 1956 começou a trabalhar nos CFM ate 1990 altura da sua reforma. Desde então dedica se a negocio de mercadoria e criação de patos para a revenda.

Conhece a HLUVUKU através de uma funcionaria da mesma dai que aproximou se e pediu o seu primeiro credito em 2007.

Com os rendimentos do negocio aumenta o volume da mercadoria na sua, suporta os encargos familiares, educação da sua família e amplia a sua obra.

Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume da mercadoria e comprar mais patos para criar e revender.

Como perspectiva do futuro pretende montar uma bomba de petróleo para fornecer ao bairro de Chinonanquila.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Theresia's Changamoto. Group

texts.en:
Theresia is 33 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 51 and 16 years old. Theresia sells cloth. She started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a bakery.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Asha's M/radau Group

texts.en:
Asha is 28 years old and is a married woman with one child, aged four. Asha is a shoes seller, a business she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $160 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Madina, who has business dealing in soft drink sales.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her business.

loans.name: Maya Tzutujil 2 Group

texts.es:
The communal bank Maya Tzutujil 2 is made up of women native to Santiago de Atitlán. The beauty of this place is seen in the pretty clothing worn by the women and the men, to a small degree, when they walk down the gray main streets that make up this town with an unmatched history. Santiago de Atitlán was one of the pressure points during the region’s civil war to which many people fell victim. Of course, generations have since passed but the memory of the tragedies remains burned in the minds of the community elders.

As its name suggests, the members of this group belong are of Maya Tzutujil descent and their ancestors have lived for centuries in the extreme west of Lake Atitlán. Nowadays the Maya Tzutujil language is mainly spoken in the towns of Santiago de Atitlán, San Pablo la Iaguna, San Juan la Iaguna and San Pedro la Iaguna.

Like many women of Santiago de Atitlán, the members of this communal bank work in the textile, embroidery and bead-based jewelry trades.

Some of the members work weaving typical blouses of the region, called “huipiles”. These women plan to invest their money in the purchase of white, blue and purples threads — the typical colors used to make huipiles. Other members weave what are known as “perrajes”, which have a number of uses. Usually it’s used as part of an outfit and is worn as a sash across a women’s shoulder as a sign of respect. Women also wrap perrajes around their heads, as in the past it was worn on this way to be a weight buffer when carrying heavy baskets. Finally, when women go to a place of worship its used to cover their heads as a sign of respect.

Other group members will purchase thread to embroider beautiful birds and flowers on the aforementioned blouses, which can be seen in the photo. This type of embroidery is typical for the town. It is the only town where the women embroider birds in such a majestic way.

Finally, some of the other members will use the loan to purchase jewelry beads to make beautiful necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings and key chains, which are made in very innovative shapes and change with the seasons. For example, during Christmas time the women make key chains of Santa Claus, reindeer, Christmas trees and the star of Bethlehem.

One can say that if he or she supports this group with its businesses he or she is also supporting the history, culture and art of Santiago de Atitlán thanks to the work of these women who dedicate themselves to express the magic of the town through their craftsmanship.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El banco comunal Maya Tzutujil 2 está conformado por mujeres oriundas de Santiago de Atitlán. La belleza de Santiago de Atitlán yace en los hermosos trajes que lucen las mujeres y los hombres, a menor escala, cuando caminan por los estrechos caminos grisáceos que conforman un pueblo con una historia inigualable. Santiago de Atitlán fue uno de los focos de tensión durante la época de la guerra civil en la región de Atitlán. Muchas personas fueron victimas de aquel conflicto. Sin embargo, las generación pasan y el recuerdo de las tragedias se quedó archivado en la mente de los sabios ancianos de la comunidad.

Como su nombre lo especifica este grupo de mujeres pertenecen al grupo étnico Maya Tzutujil. Se sabe que los Mayas Tzutujiles han vivido por siglos en el extremo sur oeste del lago Atitlán. Actualmente los se escucha el idioma Maya Tzutujil mayormente en los pueblos de Santiago de Atitlan, San Pablo la laguna, San Juan la laguna y San Pedro la laguna.

Como muchas mujeres en Santiago de Atitlan las clientes que participan en este banco comunal trabajan en tejidos, bordados y la elaboración de joyas hechas en base de mostacilla.

Un grupo de las clientes trabajan tejiendo huipiles o blusas típicas. Ellas van a invertir su dinero en la compra de hilo blanco, celeste, morado y celeste. Estos son los colores típicos utilizado a la hora de fabricar el huipil. Otras tejen perrajes. Un perraje es una pieza de tela multiuso. Usualmente es utilizado como parte de la indumentaria y esta sobrepuesta en el hombro de las mujeres para indicar respeto a los demás, también las mujeres envuelven el perraje y se lo ponen entre la cabeza y los pesados canastos que cargan sobre la cabeza para amortiguar el peso. Finalmente, cuando las mujeres van a la iglesia o al templo se cubren la cabeza con el perraje en símbolo de respeto.

Otro grupo de clientas va a comprar hilo para bordar hermosas aves y flores en los huipiles, así como se pueden ver en la foto. Este tipo de bordado es típico de este pueblo. Es el único pueblo en donde las mujeres bordan aves de una manera tan majestuosa.

Finalmente, otro grupo de clientes utiliza el crédito para comprar bolitas de mostacilla. Con la mostacilla ellas elaboran bellos collares, pulseras, anillos, aretes y llaveros. Los llaveros tienden a ser figuras muy innovadoras y acorde con la fecha del año. Por ejemplo, en la época de navidad las mujeres producen llaveros de Santa Claus, venados, árboles de Navidad y estrellas fugaces.

Uno puede decir que si uno apoya a estas mujeres con sus negocios uno también está apoyando la historia, la cultura y el arte de Santiago de Atitlan debido a que estas artesanas se dedican a expresar por medio de su arte la magia de este pueblo.

loans.use: Purchase threads to weave and embroider traditional blouses; purchase beads to make jewelry / Compra de hilo para elaborar tejidos y bordados, compra de mostacilla para elaborar joyas

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy C. lives with his wife, Simona Cuppi, and their two children in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. Freddy is a public transportation driver in La Paz and his wife sews children´s clothing which she sells in the market.

With his prior loans, he built a retaining wall in front of his home, as required by the city government in order to make improvements to the neighborhood.

The loan he is requesting will be for building a room to be used as a general store, which will generate extra income for the family. This is the sixth time he has applied for a loan and the second time through Kiva. An analysis has favorably rated this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Freddy C. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Simona Cuppi y sus dos hijos. El señor Freddy es chofer del transporte publico de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa es costurera realizando ropa de niños que vende en las ferias populares

Con anteriores créditos realizó la construcción de muro de contención en la parte frontal

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación que será utilizada como tienda para generar un ingreso mas para su familia. Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y la segunda a través de Kiva. El análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Build a room to be used as a grocery store in order to increase his income.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara L., 27, is married with 5 children and lives at Seesee on Upolu Island, Samoa. She has been making the traditional printed fabric called "elei" for a year. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week.

Sara is asking for her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (US$145). SPBD loans are Sara’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to buy equipment (paint, material, brushes, etc) for the production of elei material.

loans.use: Purchase Use for buying paintings, materials, brushes and elei woods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 55-year-old entrepreneur who runs a retail shop in Bware Migori, Kenya. She is married and has 2 children. She has received and paid back her previous loans from KMET. She now requires US$600 to further expand her shop.

loans.use: To expand her retail shop

loans.name: Muhammadsodik

texts.en:
Muhammadsodik Y. is 24 years old. He lives in Isfara town with his parents. Despite his young age, Muhammadsodik has already become the main bread-winner in his family. Muhammadsodik’s business is drying and processing apricots. He's been in this business for 6 years. His mom helps him too. 

Muhammadsodik offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. At the same time, he raises young cattle and sells them at the local market. All this allows Muhammadsodik to make his business quite successful and it brings in the stable income for the family. 

With money from this business, he paid for his university and graduated. Today Muhammadsodik is requesting 1500 Somoni (450 USD) for the term of 8 months. He is going to spend the loan purchasing half-dried apricots with the purpose of drying and processing them in order to increase the range of goods for selling. Earned money from his business he wants to use for his own wedding. Muhammadsodik expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing half-dried apricots for drying and processing

loans.name: Husnigul

texts.en:
S. Husnigul is 45 years old. She is married and has 3 adorable children. Eleven years ago Husnigul, opened a small shoe store in the central market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. With the assistance of loans through IMON, Husnigul successfully expanded her business. A skilled businesswoman, Husnigul is known throughout the market for her reasonable prices, reliable home delivery, and individualized customer service.

Husnigul requests a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900) to purchase additional inventory of children's shoes for the upcoming season. With the additional profit, she plans to continue developing her business so she can support her children's education at university. Husnigul and her children sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: Purchase children's shoes to increase the inventory and variety of shoes to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca inició el negocio para tener una ayuda extra porque su esposo no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, servicios y demás. Comenzó cuando una amiga la invito a participar por medio de la venta de productos cosméticos, ella le ayudaba a vender y le daba una comisión, después con las ganancias fue juntando dinero y se inscribió para estar ella directamente como distribuidora ya que tenía sus propios clientes, lo que le permitirá tener mejore ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $225 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar productos de pedidos que ya tiene, ella quiere incrementar sus ganancias para poder terminar un cuarto que esta construyendo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisca began her business in order to have extra help because her husband does not make enough money to cover the cost of food, services, etc. She started when a friend invited her to participate in selling cosmetic products. She helped her sell and gave her a commission. Later with her earnings she signed up to become a distributor so that now she has her own clients and a greater income.

Francisca needs to borrow $225 which she will repay in 5 months. She will use the loan to buy products to fulfill back orders. She wants to increase her earnings so that she can finish a room she is constructing in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida A. is 49 years old, married and has six children. She is from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur and her husband is a farmer. They began as tenant workers of a small parcel of rice field, and this has been their main source of income ever since. Because this did not provide enough for the family's expenses, Zenaida opened a sari-sari store to help bring in extra income for the family.

Through hard work and determination, she was able to make enough money so they could buy their own rice field. She is requesting a loan so she can buy eight bags of fertilizer which will increase the rice yield and provide more profit.

She is been an active member of CEV since 2007, and she is very grateful to be able to take part in all that CEV offers. It has truly been a blessing in her life when times are very hard.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers for a rice field.

loans.name: Milly Nampebwa’S Group

texts.en:
Milly is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 27-year-old widow with 2 children ages 4 and 7 years. Both her children go to school. She doesn’t take in additional family members. She resides in and owns a three-room house where they have electricity and no piped water. The family gets three meals a day. 

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She operates her business from her home and doesn’t incur any transportation costs since she buys from Kasubi, one of the city suburbs, and works seven days a week. Milly has been with MCDT for four years, working all along with the same groupmates, and this is her eighth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Milly is aspiring of being able to buy a full lorry of charcoal. The other group members want to do similar things.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret K. is 38 years old. She is a hard-working business lady. Margret is married with 2 children, both of them in school. She has a retail shop in Tula center. With a need to boost her business, Margret is using the loan proceeds to purchase rice, sugar, bar soap, salt, flour, and cooking oil so as to meet the demands of her ever increasing number of customers. Her dream is to open up a supermarket, hoping that the income from the business will enable her to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, bar soap, salt, flour, and cooking oil .

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo son artesanos y realizan trabajos en retablos en donde de plasma las costumbres de la zona, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Lima a través de pedidos. Además Rosa tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa. 
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas, cerveza.
Los sueños de Rosa son producir mas retablos, tener mas clientes y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Emprendedoras Communal Bank. She is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. Rosa and her husband are artisans who craft altarpieces that express the regional culture. Their products are sold by order in Lima. In addition, Rosa has a small store in her house. Rosa needs a loan for 800 soles that she will use to by soft drinks and beer. Rosa hopes to make more altarpieces, have more clients, and give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Julia Elvira

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Julia es casada tiene 50 años, tres hijos de 29, 19 y 17 años que trabajan, estudian en la universidad.
Ella estudio administración de empresas, trabajo en una óptica por catorce años, dejo el trabajo por motivos personales; hace dos años  es directora de ventas de productos de belleza por catalogo, en la zona donde vive ella capacita  a mujeres para que vendan productos de belleza por catalogo,   
Julia necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo, colonias, cremas entre otras cosas.  
Desde que pertenece al Bancomunal de Finca, ha sido una ayuda para incrementar su stock de productos de belleza por catalogo.  
El sueño de Julia es poner una óptica, porque ella trabajo por catorce años, y conoce el negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Bancomunal Los Claveles. Julia is 50 years old. She is married and has three children, 29, 19, and 17 years of age, who work and attend the university. She studied business administration and worked at an optician's for 14 years. She left that job for personal reasons, and for two years has been a director of catalog sales of beauty products in the area where she lives. She trains women to sell beauty products from a catalog. Julia needs a loan of 2600 soles in order to buy catalog beauty products, colognes, and creams, among other things. Ever since she joined the Finca Bancomunal, it has helped her increase her stock of beauty products. Julia's dream is to start an optician's shop, because she worked in one for 14 years and knows the business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy catalog beauty products, colognes, and creams

loans.name: Wosila

texts.en: Wosila A. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through the primary level. Wosila sells food supplies like groundnuts and yams at the Abura market, which she has done since 1996. Her husband is a trader. Wosila uses her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Wosila will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies like groundnuts and yams to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Wosila plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Wosila will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies like groundnuts and yams to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Sulufaiga

texts.en: Sulufaiga P. is the 53-year-old married mother of five children. She has three years of experience in the craft business and sells to the general public six days per week. She requested this loan to help her business: bowl kava, dree designs, elei, bags, earrings, and handicrafts such as uatogi. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1,000 Tala (about $416). SPBD loans are Sulufaiga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan.

loans.use: Purchases to help her business: bowl kava, dree designs, elei, bags, earrings, and handicrafts such as uatogi.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 43-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ziad has owned a grocery store for four years. He requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva's partner A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his store by diversifying his merchandise. Ziad is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking. Ziad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his store.

loans.use: Ziad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khun M. is 42 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She earns a living by raising pigs in a stall next to her house. She raises two lots of pigs per year and sells them to the slaughterer every six months. She has been earning an income of approximately $4 a day, since 2003.

She is married with five children: one of them is married and lives independently, while the other four are single and work in different jobs. Her husband is a farmer and also a firewood seller. To help reduce the cost of transportation, Khun M. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo in order to transport firewood to sell. (Mrs. Khun M.'s husband is pictured).

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo to transport firewood

loans.name: Rotimi

texts.en:
Rotimi is 49 years old and married with three children. He has a shop where he sells electronic parts.

He is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more electronic parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic parts to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 48 years old.  She is a good mother and wife to Leo Digarto who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children: Allan, Leodimar, and Amylun and they are all married.  They reside in a peaceful village of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Isabela at the moment.

Florita believes that while “there is life, there is also hope”. She said that while she is still strong, she will continue to pursue her business until it becomes progressive.  She is engaged in a small store and she also sells fruit and vegetables. She wants to make it grow and generate more income that will be very helpful to their family.  She would like to borrow a loan of PHP6,000.  Florita is also a woman full of hopes and dreams. She always strives to reach out for the goals in life that will someday benefit her children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
With a Php 3,000.00 starting capital, 34-year-old Rowena O. was able to start her lamination business. Although her first love is music, she did not pursue it because she was not contented with her income. In her present business, she is able to help her husband with their spending including the school fees of their two kids. 

In order to improve her business, Rowena joined the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and started to avail herself of its wide variety of services. In fact, she is currently applying for a Php 10,000.00 loan from CEVI that will be used in purchasing equipment for lamination.

loans.use: For lamination equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
Evella A. has been a CEVI client since 2003 and is a 50-year-old mother of four children. The eldest is 30 years old and married. She has been a fish vendor since 1984 and fish is the "bread and butter" for their family. Her husband died because of an illness, now she is alone managing her business to earn income for her own need.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 to buy fish to sell. She is thankful to God and CEVI for helping her solve their financial problems in their family.

CEVI helps her sustain her livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Geylin

texts.es: Geylin es casada, su esposo trabaja como agricultor, tienen una niña de 11 años de edad estudiando su 5to grado de primaria, vive en la colonia San Miguel de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para repellar la habitación y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, se ha caracterizado por ser una profesional muy responsable, honesta a demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia,    su familia es muy humilde pero bien unida unida,  Geylin con el crédito anterior logró construir una habitación para una mejor comodidad, aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, salud y seguir estudiando para ser una profesional que le sirve al pais.
texts.en:
Geylin is married and lives in the town of San Miguel de Nueva Guinea. Her husband is a farmer and they have an 11 year old daughter, who is a 5th grade student. She is requesting her third loan from AFODENIC so that she can plaster a room in her house, thereby improving its condition.

She is known for being a responsible and honest professional who demonstrates good conduct and moral credentials. Her family is very close even though they live modestly. Geylin’s previous loan was used to build a comfortable room. She aspires to have a home with better living conditions, a stable job, and good health. She would like to continue studying so that she can become a professional who serves her country.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster a room in her house

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 23-year-old married young woman with one child who is breastfeeding. Janet is an achiever and her hard work contributes earnestly to her family.

Janet is a food vendor and sells rice and gravy stew by the roadside in the community where she lives. She takes delivery of raw materials from Dwinase, which is a nearby market where she has access to stock. She has been in the business for the last two years, supporting the husband in taking care of the home.

Janet says demand for her food is on the high side but she does not have enough money to meet the demand. She requests the loan to buy rice, spices, vegetables, etc. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like spices, meat, vegetables and bags of rice

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Mr. Isidro is married and has one young son. He lives in Hernandarias in a very poor settlement. Isidro has a pantry for the neighborhood. He has have a few years selling a little merchandies and he wants to increase his merchandise as time goes on. 
Today he has a good shop and regular clients who know him in the community. He works very hard and is responsible for his commitments. With the loan he wants to buy various merchandise such as rice, sugar, and noodles for his shop.

loans.use: Rice, Sugar, Noodles

loans.name: Đồng Thị

texts.en:
V. Đồng Thị is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội. She is married and has two school-aged children. V. operates a family member's business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. V. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4.000.000 Vietnamese dong a month from these activities.

In 2006, V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.758.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. V. is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


V. Đồng Thị (10102110023) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, V. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  V. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, V. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2006, V. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  V. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  V. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam
