*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Linda is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business of selling charcoal.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Manuel Dejesus

texts.en:
Manuel is 23 years old. He is married to Esther, who is 22 years old and they live in Ita. 
Today Manuel has a sewing and tailoring business, but his beginnings were very difficult. When he graduated from his studies in industrial manufacturing, Manuel had no working capital to start his own business. He had to work as a driver in a building materials warehouse to save some money. He saved up enough to open a sewing workshop.

The demand for garment making has been increasing, which is why Manuel requires a new sewing machine, so that he can continue to work hard and dedicate his life to his business. 
Manuel knows that the loan represents working capital and the invaluable benefit it will bring to increasing his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: A sewing machine

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach S. weaves bamboo baskets to sell. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from other villagers, and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and to sell the baskets.

Recently, Meach sold all her baskets. To meet the needs of her customers and to earn income, she requests a loan to order baskets from other weavers to sell.

loans.use: To order baskets from other weavers to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sarn

texts.en: Sarn M. is 28 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. They have one child. Sarn M. weaves silk scarves to earn a living and is able to make about $3 USD of profit a day, while her husband (pictured here) is a farmer who is able to make $2 USD per day. Sarn M. is asking for a loan of $800 USD to purchase silk to weave silk scarves to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan M., 59, is a grocer and the mother of two young school-aged children. She is married to Mr. Ron, 66, a taxi driver. (Chan M. was not available for photographing, so her husband is pictured.) Chan M. hopes to generate more income for her family and is asking for a loan to build a small shop in front of her home where her husband will provide a vehicle repair service.

loans.use: To build a small shop.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Gregoria Village Brgy 3, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by manufacturing hollow blocks. Gemma’s husband, Jeorge, helps her run the business. They have three children who are between 17 and 23 years old. Two of the children have already graduated from college and now are seeking employment. One of her children is still going to school.

Gemma B. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in manufacturing hollow blocks. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000 from her business activities.

Gemma B. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 was used to fund operations of her manufacturing business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 8,000 for her 16th loan, which she intends to use on her business.  Gemma B. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Alex Manuel

texts.es:
Alex tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente hace 3 años, tiene una hija de 2 años de 
edad. El vive en casa de sus padres con su familiar. El inicio en el negocio 
aproximadamente hace 3 años, en donde adquirió la mototaxi con las utilidades 
obtenidas en la temporada que se dedico a la minería informal. El tiene brindando este 
servicio ya hace 3 años. Alex y su cónyuge sueñan con tener su casa propia ya que por 
el momento los están ayudando sus padres. Alex destina todos los ingresos que obtiene 
a la manutención de su menor hija. Alex solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y para la  compra de algunos repuestos, para asi no tener problemas con su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alex is 25 years old, and has lived with a partner for 3 years. He has a 2 year-old daughter. He lives with his family in his parent's house. He started up his business about 3 years ago, when he acquired a mototaxi (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) with the earnings he made during the time he worked in the informal mining sector. He has provided mototaxi service for 3 years. Alex and his partner dream of having their own home, since at the moment they are being helped by his parents. Alex uses all of his earnings for the support of his young daughter. Alex requests a loan to use to perform maintenance work on his mototaxi, and to buy some spare parts for it, so that he will not have problems with his instrument of work.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
En grupo María Auxiliadora está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras una de ellas es Walesca del Rosario R. V. quien es la coordinadora del grupo. Esta joven como muchos nicaragüenses que desean estudiar y superarse pero sus condiciones económicas no se los permite. Es entonces que decide empezar a vender zapatos para así costear sus estudios que gracias a Dios está culminando.

Las otras integrantes son María Elena V. quien tiene una mini pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace 10 años y María Mercedes Hernández describe su comercio como mercadería en general; ya que ella comercializa desde ropa, joyería, zapatos y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora group was formed by three enterprising women. Walesca del Rosario R. V. is the coordinator of the group. This young woman, like many Nicaraguans, wishes to study and better herself, but her economic conditions do not allow it. She has decided to start selling shoes in order to pay for her studies that, thanks to God, are concluding. The other members are Maria Elena V., who has had a tiny store in her house for 10 years, and Maria Mercedes Hernández who describes her trade as general merchandise as she sells clothes, jewelry, shoes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Inas

texts.en:
Inas has worked as a hairdresser for the past 12 years. She opened a home-based business in 2000 to help her husband in raising their three young children. She has a special room at home which she has prepared to receive her clients.
Today, Inas is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to buy additional supplies such as beauty products, hair colors and hair accessories. She also wants to add new services to attract more clients and make a good income for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies such as beauty products, hair colors and hair accessories

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Eugénie est mariée à AFFANOU Kuassi Marcel, un pêcheur. Eugénie est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Fiégnon à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Eugénie n'a pas été à l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Eugénie vend des poissons fumés de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Eugénie vend du maïs et de la farine de manioc. C'est au port de pêche à Cotonou que Eugénie  achète ses poissons. Eugénie mène cette activité depuis 15 ans environs et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Eugénie voudrait agrandir son activité et satisfaire davantage sa clientèle. C'est ce qui amène Eugénie à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Eugénie K. is married to Kuassi Marcel AFFANOU, a fisherman. Eugénie is the mother of five children, all having attended (or still attending) school. Eugénie herself has not attended school. The family lives in Fiégnon in Cotonou. The couple shares the various family expenses. To meet her needs and those of her children, Eugénie sells smoked fish as an itinerant vendor. She also sells corn and cassava flour as a secondary activity. She buys her fish at the fishing port in Cotonou. Eugénie has been in business for about 15 years and has already been granted three loans from ALIDé, all of which have been repaid in full. She would like to expand her activity and increase customer satisfaction, which is why she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fresh fish

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es:
Salomón es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Angurucal del distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la comercialización de ganado caprino y ovino, el visita caseríos cercanos para comprar ovejas y chivos, los cuales engorda para luego venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona. Este negocio le brinda los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante y sostener la economía de su familia, por lo que trata siempre de mantenerlo con mucho esfuerzo.

Salomón desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para criarlos y venderlos. Siguiendo este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre de familia bastante entregado a su trabajo y que siempre vela por el bienestar de los suyos. Su mayor enhelo es poder adquirir una motocarga (vehículo motorizado especializado en el transporte de carga) que le permita recorrer los caseríos de la zona y trasladar su mercadería con mayor facilidad ya que las distancias que tiene que cubrir son grandes y esto dificulta el desarrollo de su negocio
texts.en:
Salomón is a father of a family. He is 37 years old and lives together with his wife and children in the farmhouse Angurucal in the Olmos district, located in the Lambayeque province an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than three years, he has worked selling goat and sheep livestock. He visits local farms to buy sheep and goats, which he fattens to sell later to businessman visiting the zone. His business provides him the income he needs to get ahead in life and maintain his family economically, so he exerts a lot of effort in trying to maintain it. Salomón wants to grow his business by purchasing more animals to raise and sell. To do this, he realizes the necessity of asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first loan of 1000 nuevo soles. He is a father very devoted to his work and always watches over the welfare of his children. His biggest dream is to be able to get a "motocarga" (a motorized vehicle specialized for cargo transport), which will allow him to travel travel to area farms and move his merchandise with greater ease. The distances he has to cover are great, which makes growing his business difficult.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying lamb and goat livestock to increase his business

loans.name: Nsasa Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Leocadia is 35 years old and is married with four school-going children. She runs a five-year-old dairy business selling milk in Nsasa, Mukono. In a week, this cheerfully approachable woman reckons she makes 90,000 shillings.

The major challenge Leocadia has faced since she began has been the low volume of milk supplies she gets from her suppliers, most of them small-scale cattle keepers. With this loan, she wants to buy her own thoroughbred cow that will give her enough milk so that she does not run out of supplies.

loans.use: To purchase a thoroughbred cow of her own

loans.name: Galsandorj

texts.en: Galsandorj M., 47, is married and the father of three children. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). Two of his children attend a local secondary school. Galsandorj operates a vegetable planting business in his town. He has been operating his business since 2002, and has become an experienced planter over the past eight years. As it is a seasonal business, he also operates a block manufacturing business during the summer months. In addition to these businesses, Galsandorj also works as a custodian in a local kindergarten. He is a very hard working person and a great businessman, as well as a good father for his family. Galsandorj is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan for his vegetable planting business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap T., 42 years old, is a villager who lives in Ta Vong village, Takeo province. She is a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Noeun Bun, is a motorbike and bicycle repairer at home. With both businesses, they earn a small income to support the family. To support both businesses, Mrs. Pheap T. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding and to purchase motorbike and bicycle supplies to support her husband's business. This couple has five children; one is a construction worker, one is a congee seller, and one is a bicycle repairer. The other two are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig food and motorbike/bicycle supplies

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité La Amistad del barrio Yka´a de la Fracción Las Abellanas de la ciudad de Luque, se formó gracias a que señoras de otro grupo de un barrio vecino, les habían comentado a las mismas sobre el programa del comité e invitaron a que formaran un nuevo comité en esa zona. 
Ellas están trabajando de forma unida para generar mas ingresos para sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elva A. quién se dedica a elaboración de diversos tipos de  dulces gran cantidad.
 
Ella compra las frutas y prepara los dulces y luego recorre varios negocios donde ofrece sus productos. 
Además tiene un negocio donde vende juguetes, ropas, y utensilio para el hogar.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora y mantiene a sus hijos de  la mejor manera posible.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de envases de diversos tamaños ya que desea envasar sus productos para una mejor presentación, y manejo de los dulces.
texts.en:
The community bank La Amistad, in the Yka´a neighborhood in the Las Abellanas section of the city of Luque, was formed thanks to women in another group in a neighboring part of the city, who told them about the community bank program and invited them to form a new group in their area. They are working in a united form to generate more income for their families. One of the members is Señora Elva A., who prepares different types of jams in great quantities. She buys the fruits and prepares the jams and then goes around to a number of businesses where they offer her products. In addition, she has a business where she sells toys, clothing, and household utensils. She is a very hard-working woman and provides for her children in the best way possible. She is applying for this loan to purchase containers of different sizes because she wants to package her products for better presentation and handling.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic and glass containers of different sizes.

loans.name: Juan Obispo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Juan; el socio  tiene 38 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, él socio tienen una tienda de abarrotes, el se dedica a la atención diaria de este su negocio, Él socio apoya a su conyugue con sus estudios de enfermería, este socio es muy alegre y lleno de energías y sueños, El desea comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes y otros para implementar su mercadería para este mes, él socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Arcángel Gabriel Communal Bank. The member lives in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Juan is the member. He is 38 years old. The member is in a common law marriage, and he has two children. The member has a grocery store, and he works in it everyday. The member supports his life partner with her nursing studies. The member is very happy and full of energy and dreams. He wishes to buy rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, and other products to stock his merchandise this month. He is requesting the loan to stock his store with groceries. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. The loan allows him to grow with his business and improve his quality of life. He pledges to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store with groceries

loans.name: Taï

texts.fr:
Taï D. est une femme de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de vêtements. Une activité qu'elle mène depuis plus de 05 ans. Comme activité secondaire elle fait la vente de bijoux en or plaqué. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar et revend à Ziguinchor. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 19 février 2001. Elle a 18 fois reçu de crédit et a toujours bien remboursé. Elle vend souvent à crédit et fait ses recouvrements à la fin de chaque mois. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter 38 ensembles de vêtement, 20 colliers en plaqué or. 

Elle participe au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants, à leur habillement  et à la prise en charge de leur santé.
texts.en:
Taï D. is a 48-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children. She has a small business involving clothing that she has been running for five years. As a secondary business, she sells gold-plated jewelry. She purchases her goods from Dakar and resells them in Ziguinchor. Taï has been a member of the Banc Villageois of COLOBANE FASS since February 19, 2001. She has received a loan eighteen times and has always repaid them. She often sells on credit and collects payment at the end of each month. With her new loan, she is going to buy 38 outfits and 20 gold-plated necklaces. She is helping to cover her children's schooling costs, as well as their clothing and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 38 outfits and 20 necklaces to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 55-year-old married man from Lebanon with four children. He has owned a mini-market in his village for the past 12 years. He sells in his grocery shop all types of food products, dairy products, juices, soft drinks, beads etc. His shop is situated in a busy area so there are a good number of customers passing by his shop. This is his second loan requested from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He has been very reliable with his repayments. He is requesting a larger loan amount of $2,000 to increase his shop inventory to be prepared for the coming holidays in Lebanon where the selling rate will be increased. He’s very optimist about the results.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To increase his shop inventory

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat A. is a resident of Tup, a nice town in the Isykul region with a population of 15,000 people. She is 52 years old and married. She has raised five daughters. The first daughter is married and lives separately with her family, the second studies at the university and the other daughters are at school.  

Rahat has been engaged in farming since 1995. She also breeds cattle. Rahat applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase 300 liters of fuel. In the future she wants to build a big house and give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es: Mirtha, de 51 años, vive en su casa que es propia, que esta hecha de material noble, en compañía de su esposo Sergio de 53 años y de su joven hija Mayra de 18 años, pues sus otros 5 hijos son mayores e independientes. Desde que se unió con su esposo pensó en instalar un negocio, y con el paso del tiempo decidió empezar con la venta de diferentes comestibles en su casa. Luego de un tiempo el pequeño negocio creció y ahora tiene en toda la esquina de su casa una surtida bodega, pues ofrece variados comestibles y gaseosas. Dice que el trabajo es tranquilo, pues no sale de su casa, y además cuenta con la ayuda de su joven hija quien atiende  durante sus ratos libres, de esta manera ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como es una dama muy trabajadora, también se dedica al bordado de pedrería en prendas de vestir, y para lograrlo trabaja durante las mañanas en esta labor, pero trabaja con un intermediario, que le deja las prendas y después las recoge cuando el trabajo esta terminado. Además para el futuro tiene planeado surtir mejor su tienda de comestibles y comprar nuevos estantes para exhibir de la mejor manera sus productos.  Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas ya que no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mirtha tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en comestibles y gaseosas para surtir mejor su tienda, y además destinará una parte en la compra de mostacillas y lentejuelas (pedrería) que le hace falta para terminar de elaborar unas prendas de vestir que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 51, she owns a house made of good material and lives there with her husband Sergio, 53 and their daughter Mayra 18, her other five children are older and independent. When she got married she thought of starting a business and as time went by she decided to sell groceries from her home. After a while the small business grew and now she has a whole area of the house a well stocked store where she offers groceries and soda. She says work is calm because she doesn’t leave the house and she also has the help of her daughter that works at the store in her free time, this way she helps her husband with the home expenses. Because she is a hardworking lady she also works doing hand beading on clothing, which she does during the mornings, she works with a third party that drops of the clothing to be beaded and picks it up when the beading is finished. For the future, she plans to stock her store with more food and buy new shelves to show the products better. This is the sixth loan with MFP and she promises to make her repayments on time because she doesn’t want to disappoint all the people that made the loan possible and that will allow her to work in search of progress. Mirtha plans to invest the loan requested in buying food and pop to stock her store better, part of the loan will also be used to buy beads to finish working on some clothes she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with various products

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy B. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Daisy is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Daisy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Daisy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.

loans.name: We Dae Pay Quick Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “We Dae Pay Quick” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured in the left is Isatu T. who is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Makeni; she is age sixty-one. She is a widow with seven children most of whom are now grown-ups and living on their own. 

Isatu sells cooking oil, salt, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in bulk.

loans.use: Buy cooking oil, salt, Maggi cubes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a stand and merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Tserenbyamba

texts.en: Tserenbyamba T. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in her parents' yard. Her daughter attends a local primary school while her husband works as a driver. Tserenbyamba operates a car spare parts trading business in her local town. She sells a variety of machinery parts through her two shops. She started her business in 2006 selling spare parts at the local market and has built a stable and successful operation. In 2008, she used her earnings to build a new workplace where she operates her business. Over the years, she has managed to expand her business by renting one more stall in the local market and now sells products through her two different shops. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a car for her family. Today her working capital has reached up to 5,000,000 MNT. She hopes to one day have her own house and fence where her family can live. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy machinery parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy machinery parts

loans.name: Monica  Antonia

texts.es: La señora Mónica C. tiene un pequeño almacén de misceláneas en el cual vende perfumes, calzado, ropa exterior e interior femenina, prendas de fantasía, accesorios y artículos de papelería. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 17 y 12 años quienes en sus ratos libres le colaboran en atender el negocio. La experiencia de la microempresaria en el comercio se remonta al año 1999 cuando empezó vendiendo productos por catálogos, hace dos años decidió comprar una vitrina exhibidora y surtirla con todos los productos que vende. La mayoría de su clientela son vecinos del sector, amigos y referidos de otros barrios. Generalmente las ventas son de contado, pero en ocasiones otorga créditos con plazos hasta de 45 días. El monto promedio de las ventas diarias es de $ 60.000 y el margen de ganancia es de aproximadamente 40%. Este es el primer crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá en la compra de ropa, calzado y regalos. Se espera que las ventas se incrementen considerablemente en el mes de Diciembre por la temporada de fin de año. La señora Mónica es una persona muy colaboradora con sus vecinos y amigos, algunos de los cuales son usuarios de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y la han recomendado ampliamente. Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran almacén y colaborarle a su esposo en la financiación de los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Mónica C. has a small shop of miscellaneous goods where she sells perfume, shoes, clothing, underwear, fancy clothing, accessories, and stationery. She is married and has two children, 17 and 12 respectively, and in her spare time she runs her business. Her experience as a small businesswoman began in 1999 when she started selling catalog products. Two years ago she decided to purchase a display case and fill it with the different products she sold. Most of her clients are neighbors, friends, and people who have been referred to her. Generally payment is made on delivery, but on occasion she extends credit for up to 45 days. Her average revenues are 60,000 and her profit margin is about 40%. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and she will use it to buy clothing, shoes, and gifts. She hopes that her sales increase during the month of December for the end of the year shopping season. Monica is a great collaborator with her neighbors and friends others of whom are members of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and they wholeheartedly recommend her. Her dream is to have a large store and work with her husband to provide her children with a university education.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, shoes, and gifts

loans.name: Mazoea

texts.en: Mazoea is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that doesn't have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mazoea has operated an open air food market for the past three years, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. Mazoea faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to be self reliant in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, sacks of beans, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, cooking oil, sacks of beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Shafiqa

texts.en: Shafiqa S. is a 60 year-old-woman who lives with her husband and three sons in Sabirabad. Shafiqa started to grow and  sell vegetables and fruits in 2003. Her son helps her in this business and this is the main source of income for her family. After successfully repaying the previous loan Shafiqa took out new loan of 1000 AZN. to expand her business. Shafiqa plans to expand her business in the future, and grow enough vegetables and fruits to sell in the winter.

loans.use: to expand her farming business

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men K., 36, sells groceries, earning an income of $6.30 per day. K. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. 

The family has to spend $23.80 on food, $3.70 on electricity supply and $22.50 on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K., 24 years old, is married to Nancy Kazi and together they have one son. Nancy works as a hairdresser, providing some income for the family. John operates  a motorcycle transportation service and also sells used clothes. He has been in this business for three years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This will be John's first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use it to buy one bail of used clothes to resell. With the interest that he will get, he wants to buy more used clothes to resell. In the future, John would like to be a used clothes distributor, buy a car and start taxi work.

loans.use: to buy one bail of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Margaret  Achieng

texts.en:
Margaret Achieng O. is 43 years old and married.  She and her husband Judas have grown children who are working.

Margaret has been selling charcoal in Kayole estate for 2 years now.  Her business has great potential because the area where she is located has many possible customers of both middle and low income.  She earns a profit of KES 10,000 per month. 

She is applying for her third loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD, after paying back the previous loans successfully. She plans to use the loan to open a stall and add to her stock of charcoal for sale. With her anticipated profit, she plans to  open another location for selling charcoal.

In the future she desires to grow her business and have a very large shop where she can supply charcoal to hotels. Margaret is active and a very hard-working lady. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend.

loans.use: To open a stall and add to her stock of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de sept femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de leurs activités de petit commerce dans le marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des pagnes wax, des habits, de la friperie (communément appelée en Bambara : yougou-yougou), d’encens et du savon. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème prêt solidaire. Tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame Ramata D. a une grande réputation dans la vente d’encens à Hamdallaye surtout auprès des jeunes mariées. Elle  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 kg de Magnonkissèni, 10 bouteilles d’eau de Cologne et une dizaine de tube de parfums de qualité. Elle se ravitaille en ces produits au grand marché de Ségou en gros.
Pour faire de l’encens, elle imbibe le Magnonkissèni dans l’eau de Cologne pendant une semaine au moins ensuite elle l’assaisonne avec du parfum. L’encens ainsi obtenu est réparti enfin entre les bouteilles pour être vendu.  
La revente se fait en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant et au marché Château à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Ramata  D. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité,  prendre en charge les besoins du foyer et la scolarisation des enfants. 
NB : Hinda Koné a accouché raison pour laquelle elle ne figure pas sur la photo
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of seven married woman, generally from monogamous families and with an average age 43 and five children each. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They became acquainted through kinship and through their sales activities at the Château de Ségou market.

The group members buy and sell “pagnes wax” (colorful West African fabrics), clothing, used clothing (commonly called "yougou-yougou" in the Bambara language), incense, and soap. In order to increase their working capital and pay cash for supplies, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. The four previous loans are fully repaid.

Mrs. Ramata D. has a good reputation as an incense merchant in Hamdallaye, especially with young married women. She plans to use her loan to buy two kilograms of "Magnonkissèni" (seeds of a wild plant), ten bottles of cologne, and ten tubes of quality fragrances. She buys these items wholesale at the big market in Ségou. To make incense, she soaks Magnonkissèni in cologne for at least a week, then adds fragrance. The resulting incense is put in bottles to be sold retail for cash and credit. She sells from her home, as an ambulant vendor, and at the Château market, primarily to women.

With this loan Mrs. Ramata D. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFA, which will be reinvested in the business and used for household expenses and school fees.

Note:  Hinda Koné is not pictured because she was in labor.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make incense

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Meiby Orquidea

texts.es:
Meiby, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel,tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad, es empleada en una unidad de salud encargada de archivo, al mismo tiempo y con ayuda de su esposo tienen un taller de vehículos, desde hace 10 años, por el momento su dificultad es la falta de repuestos y herramientas por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de estos materiales tan importantes para el buen funcionamiento del taller.
Esta inversión le ayudara a contar con las herramientas necesarias para atender los desperfectos mecánicos de los vehículos que los clientes lleven, así ofrecerá un mejor servicio.
Su aspiración es crecer con el local del taller, ampliándolo para estar más cómodos y atender a un número mayor de vehículos, también garantizar una mejor condición a su familia.
texts.en:
Meiby lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel department. She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and their two daughters aged 5 and 3. She is an archivist working in a health unit; on top of this, she and her husband have been running a repair shop for 10 years. Their main current difficulty is the lack of spare parts and tools; for this reason she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy the key items she needs for the garage to be fully operational.
This investment will help her buying the necessary tools to repair the mechanical flaws of her customers’ vehicles, thus enabling her to provide a better service.
She wishes to see her garage grow, and to enlarge it both to have a more comfortable working space and to hold a higher number of vehicles; she also wants to guarantee better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Alfonso De Jesus

texts.es: Don Alfonso se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, desde hace 8 años. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de 16 y 10 años, que están a su cargo. Empezó con esfuerzo propio, ya que necesitaba un medio de ingreso que le generara lo necesarios, este negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, y él desea que su negocio crezca, es por eso que él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts, vestidos, trajes, camisetas y sabanas. Su meta es agrandar su inventario para tener una mayor producción.
texts.en: Alfonso has had a business selling used clothing for 8 years.  He has two minor children aged 16 and 10, who are in his care.  He started his business with his own efforts, since he needed to have a means of generating income to pay for the necessities of life.  This business has allowed him to provide for his family, and he wants to see the business grow.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, suits, T-shirts and bed sheets.  His goal is to expand his inventory so that he can increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, suits, T-shirts and bed sheets

loans.name: Felipe Israel

texts.es:
El señor Felipe Israel tiene ya mas de diez y siete años dedicándose a  su taller de soldadura, realiza figuras y protecciones de fiero y aluminio. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar una maquina más grande para soldar y material para realizar los pedidos que tiene pendientes. Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión, y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso del su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá  ya teniendo su maquina nueva y podrá entregar los pedidos que tiene pendiente a tiempo.
texts.en:
Mr. Felipe Israel has been running a welding workshop for over 17 years.  He makes iron and aluminum railings and gates.  He is requesting a loan to buy larger welding equipment and material to be able to fill the orders he has already taken. 

He does not have the necessary funds for the investment right now because he cannot decapitalize the business as it is his family's only source of income.  He plans to pay back the loan with the profits he will make once he has his new machine and is able to deliver the goods he has on back-order.

loans.use: To buy new welding machinery

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira T. is the treasurer of this group. She is 48 and married to a postman. Together with her husband, she is bringing up a son and three daughters. The son is a farmer, the first daughter is a nurse, and the other daughters study at school. 

In order to add to the family budget, Damira sells grocery products. At the same time, the family breeds cattle. They have been doing it since 1996, when the collective farms broke up. With money received from the loan, Damira wants to purchase cattle for breeding. In the near future she wants to start repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo, de 38 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de San Miguel, vive en su propia casa junto  a sus 02 queridos hijos, quienes son su mayor fortaleza. La labor que realiza Leonardo es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café y plátano, en total cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno. Sus padres le enseñaron  a remover la tierra y con sus ahorros acumulados pudo concretar sus ansias de contar con su propia parcela. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo; tiene 10 años de experiencia y nos cuenta que cuando es temporada de cosecha sus hijos la ayudan, mientras que los jornaleros que contrata los ayuda a trasladar los productos hasta cierto tramo; para luego comercializarlos. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos perjudicando a sus sembríos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de café para aumentar su producción.
texts.en: Leonardo is 38 years old and is a native of the city of San Miguel. He lives in his own home with his two beloved sons who are his greatest strength. Leonardo is a farmer and he grows cacao, coffee and bananas in four acres. His parents taught him how to till the soil and with his savings he was able to realize his desire to have his own plot. He understands the hard work in the field since he has 10 years of experience. Leonardo tells us that during the harvest season his sons help him while the day laborers that he employs help move the products to a certain section so that he can later sell them. He is very committed to his work because thanks to his daily efforts he can now enjoy seeing that his crops result in a good profit. He tells us that he does not like the winter season because insects abound during these months and result in damage to his crops. This is his sixth loan with field partner MFP and he knows that if he pays on time he will have access to another loan with greater confidence. He is thankful to this institution for granting him this loan. With the loan he is requesting he will purchase coffee seeds so that he can increase his production.

loans.use: to purchase coffee seeds.

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en:
Mrs. Enebish is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. Erdenet is famous for its copper production. Her two children are both studying at university. 

Enebish’s husband, Boldchuluun, is a plumber and works for a construction company. 

Since 2002, Mrs.Enebish has been running a tailoring business. She makes new dresses by customers order and also fixes dresses. Last year, she started a building project to build a family house and the project is 70 percent complete. The project was stopped due to the winter season and shortage of money, and now she is planning to finish the building project. 

The loan she is asking for will be used to buy building materials such as cement, sand, plaster, laminated floor, main entrance and internal doors and bricks to complete the family's house-building project.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, sand, plaster, laminated floor, main entrance and internal doors and bricks to complete the family's house-building project.

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is a 30-year-old mother for five children; she has been married to Amjad, a school bus driver, for 11 years now. 

Four years ago Suhad started selling home products at her house; she sells items such as melamine plates, glasses, pans, etc. She has gained her neighbors' and customers' trust. 

Now Suhad is applying for a loan to raise her capital and to buy more products so she can make more profit from selling them.

loans.use: To buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 56 years old. She is widowed and has four grown-up children. She runs a grocery store in which she stocks kale, tomatoes, cabbages and green vegetables, all of which she sells to the local people. Her business is located in a residential area known as Huruma in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. She has been in this business for nine years now. She says that the business is profitable and her major challenge is financial constraints. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase stock of groceries to grow her business while meeting the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to own a big grocery store and dreams of building a residential house for her family. She describes herself as God-fearing.

loans.use: to add stock.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 24 years old and is married with seven children aged between 2 and 12 years old. He has three years experience in his business selling various produce such as sorghum, beans, etc. His business is well-organized. He currently employs one person to help him.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more produce such as Irish potatoes, beans, sorghum, etc. for sale. He will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in his business and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Piedras De Oro Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cristina es soltera, tiene 23 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, se dedica a los oficios domésticos como también al comercio a la reventa D. ropa típica, inicio con un poco D. capital que tenia ahorrado, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años D. experiencia.

DeciD. organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital D. trabajo, para la compra D. ropa típica: cortes, güipiles, suéteres, fajas, para revenderlos, ya que  quiere ver su negocio mejor y surtido. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas como: el comercio y la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is single and 23-years-old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She spends her time working at domestic chores as well as reselling traditional clothing, a business she started with a small amount of capital she had saved.  Up to this point she has five years of experience.  

She decided to organize a group with the goal of requesting a loan that would enable her to expand her working capital for buying traditional clothing: cortes (skirts), güipiles (highly decorated long shifts worn over the corte), sweaters, and fajas (woven belts) to resell them as she would like to see her business better stocked.  The other members of the group work in various areas such as business and agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for resale.

loans.name: Nuestra Solución Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Nuestra Solución” está conformado por 21 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación y venta de comida rápida, venta de perfumes, producción y venta de quesos, además de artesanía en madera, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción. 
Sonia integrante del banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, siendo la primera socia de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo una chaqueta color amarillo y gorro color negro, se dedica a la fabricación de productos de artesanía, entre éstos aros, anillos, pulseras en macramé (tejido hecho con nudos de estructura parecida al encaje), además realiza bolsos y billeteras de cuero. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 6 años. Comenta que durante la temporada de invierno, las ventas han disminuido, debido a las huelgas estudiantiles, sin embargo comenta que a partir del mes de septiembre es una buena temporada, por lo que las ventas aumentan. Su horario es de 11:00 de la mañana hasta las 20:00 horas. 
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en distribuidoras.
Con el crédito comprará materiales, específicamente lanas y cueros de diferentes colores y texturas. 
Sus metas son incrementar su negocio.
Ella vive junto a su marido y su hijo de 11 años de edad, sus sueños en general, son que su negocio prospere y le pueda brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Sonia está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, en especial de la calidez generada al interior del grupo del Banco comunal, comenta además que los emprendedores son muy trabajadores y comprometidos con sus negocios. 
La socia que aparece en el recuadro superior izquierdo, no pudo asistir a la sesión fotografica del grupo del Banco comunal, debido a un inconveniente personal que tuvo que resolver, es por esto que debió ausentarse durante la reunión. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Biobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Nuestra Solución” (Our Solution) and consists of 21 entrepreneurs who engage in business activities such as preparing and selling fast food, selling perfumes, making and selling cheese, making handicrafts out of wood, and other trades.  All of them are from the city of Concepción.

Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank.  In the photograph, she is the first person standing on the left-hand side wearing a yellow jacket and black cap.  She makes earrings, rings, and bracelets with macramé (fabric that is woven into a lace-like pattern).  Sonia also makes handbags and wallets out of leather.  She has been in this trade for six years. Sonia says that her sales diminish during the winter when students go on break.  However, she says the month of September is good for her because her sales go up at that time.  Her work schedule is from 11am to 8pm.  Her merchandise is generally sold to distributors.  With this loan, Sonia will buy materials, specifically wool and leather in different colors and textures.  Her goal is to increase her business.

Sonia lives with her husband and her 11-year-old son.  Her dreams in general are to prosper in her business and to provide her family a better quality of life.  Sonia is very pleased with and thankful for the services provided by Fondo Esperanza, especially the kindness that is expressed by her Communal Bank group.  She says that the members are hardworking entrepreneurs who are committed to their businesses.  

The member who appears in the upper left hand corner could not attend the photo session of the communal bank due to a personal obligation that she had to resolve. It is for this reason that she was allowed to be absent during the meeting. 

Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Biobío River, one of the largest in Chile.  It is located in the southern part of the country in the Biobío region.  Concepción played an important role in Chilean history.  It was the site of important battles and became a major settlement, especially during the Arauco War, since it lies on the border with the Mapuche territory.  Concepción now experiences significant economic and demographic development.  It is considered to be one of the urban areas that has developed into a major administrative, financial, and commercial center within Chile, just behind Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy wool and leather.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en: Gumercinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has earned a living for the last 10 years by running a shell-crafting business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy the materials she needs to make more items to sell to her customers. She supplements the income she earns from this business by also making furniture. She has done well thanks to her own efforts and the help from NWTF, and dreams of saving enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for a shell-crafting business

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
A sus 61 años de edad, Mariela es una gran luchadora pues al separarse de su esposo se vio obligada a iniciar su propio negocio en compañía de uno de sus hijos, juntos empezaron a reparar zapatos y bolsos y a elaborar sandalias. 

Mariela y su hijo realizan su labor en la Comuna 13 de Medellín en donde está ubicada su casa. Actualmente esta emprendedora necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos y materia prima para continuar con su labor.
texts.en:
At the age of 61, Mariela is quite the fighter because when she separated from her husband she was forced to start her own business with one of her children.  Together they started to repair shoes and purses and to manufacture sandals.

Mariela and her son work in Medellín’s Comuna 13 neighborhood where their house is located.  At present, this entrepreneur needs a loan to buy supplies and raw materials to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Martin Eudocio

texts.es: El Señor Martin es soltero con 02 hijos de 25 y 30 años de edad, tiene su negocio hace 02 años que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (pollo, azúcar, leche, arroz, verduras),  productos de limpiezas (lejia, jabón, shampoo), entre otros  el crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra de más mercaderia para abastecer así mejor su negocio y así sus clientes tenga mejores opciones a la hora de comprar. Su gran desafío del Señor Martin es un dolor a los huesos que lo viene llevando hace varios años. Su gran sueño del señor es incrementar mejor su tienda para así poder tener mejores ingresos, además de terminar de construir su vivienda para poder tener una mejor comodidad tanto él y sus nietos, a la vez está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Martin is single and has two children, ages 25 and 30. For the past two years, he has managed a business selling groceries (chicken, sugar, milk, rice, vegetables) and cleaning products (bleach, soap, shampoo). The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise so that he can better stock his business. This will provide his customers better options when they purchase.

His greatest challenge is the pain in his bones that he has been experiencing for many years. On the other hand, his greatest wish is to expand his store so that she can generate more revenue. In addition, he wants to finish the construction of his house so that he and his grandchildren will be more comfortable. Martin is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has been in the transportation industry for the last six years. He operates a motorbike taxi, locally known as bodaboda. He is 27 years old, married and supports three people in his family. 

He learned about KADET LTD, through a staff member of KADET. He has been a good client, thus applies for his second loan which he plan to use to expand his taxi business. He wants to expand from operating a motorbike (bodaboda) and buy a car, which can provide better returns. 

He hopes to generate income and use the income to repay the loan. He dreams to be rich in the future. He is an industrious person who can do more, if provided with resources.

loans.use: to expand his taxi business.

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Domitila tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 4 hijos, Maria se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la elaboración de tortillas y venta de leche, tiene muchos años de experiencia y sus clientes son permanentes, muchas personas le compran sus ricas tortillas ya que el lugar de ventas es muy higienico y son muy sabrosas las tortillas. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos para la fabricacion de las tortillas y tambien para compra de leche.
las ganacias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Domitila, 40, is married and has 4 children. Maria is a merchant, making tortillas and selling milk. She has many years of experience and a permanent clientele. Many people buy her delicious tortillas because they're tasty and because her store is very hygienic. 

The loan will be used to buy ingredients for making tortillas and also to buy milk. She needs the income to cover the costs of her home.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and milk.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila lives in Sagarejo in the Kakheti District. She is 49 years old.  Leila lives with her husband Michael. She works at a local high school in the position of a cleaner. Along with her main job, she also helps her husband in the family's agricultural business.  Leila and Michael grow mushrooms in their greenhouse. They sell the harvested mushrooms in the village. The total average income for the family is 600 Laris (USD 360) per month. 

Leila will purchase seeds for the mushrooms with the borrowed amount and sow them. In a month, Leila will sell the harvested products and earn profit. She plans to reinvest the earned profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy mushroom seeds

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr: Monsieur Khadim est âgé de 28 ans. Il vit au Sénégal. Il s’active dans le secteur de l’aviculture et est en meme temps surveillant. Il a choisi son métier par nécessité  dans  le but d’augmenter ses revenus. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2005. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000frs prévu pour l’achat de poussins et d’aliments en vue de renforcer ses sujets. Il souhaite préparer une bonne  opération de vente  de poulets d’ici un mois. Son souhait est d’élargir son activité et avec l’augmentation de ses revenus il  pourra améliorer son niveau de vie et soutenir ses proches.
texts.en: Monsieur Khadim is 28 and he lives in Sénégal. He works in the poultry field and is also a monitor. He chose his trade out of necessity in order to grow his income. He has been a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC since 2005. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs intended to buy chicks and chicken feed in order to grow his flock. He hopes to have a good operation selling young chickens in a month's time. His desire is to expand his business and with the expansion of his income, he will be able to improve his living conditions and support those near and dear to him.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Badnaanyambuu

texts.en:
Badnaanyambuu is a 28 year old computer programmer and web designer.  He started his business in 2009 and already has some permanent clients. 

He lives with his wife in the house of his parents.  But recently he bought a house and a small lot in Mandal Soum, a northern town of Mongolia.

To get moved out from his parents house he is taking a loan to help cover the cost of his new house.

loans.use: to help cover the cost of his new house.

loans.name: Kamutu

texts.en:
Kamutu is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has been operating a small retail shop for the last four years, with a monthly profit of KES 3,000. 

Kamutu was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 20,000 from the company, which she plans to use to add additional stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, washing soap and other household commodities for sale. 

She will save the anticipated profit and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and own her own well stocked retail shop.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil and washing soap for sale.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is married with one child. Arsenia is 54 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Arsenia sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase flour and sugar for her snack vending business.

Arsenia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Arsenia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour and sugar for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Gülden

texts.en:
Gulden is 33 years old, married and has two children.  For 15 years, she has been selling a variety of cosmetics to her neighborhood.  She finds that selling Oriflame products is more convenient and profitable than other cosmetic brands.  Additionally, she thinks that selling Oriflame products will widen her customer base.  With this loan she will buy these products wholesale. Oriflame has employee campaigns that give away promotional gifts that she can in turn sell and make more profit (these are not samples).  In the future, she wants to expand her business and make more profit.  She wants to use her monetary gains to support her children’s education.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff and volunteers

Gülden Hanım,33 yaşında,evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  Çevresine,komşularına  15 yıldır kozmetik ürünleri satıyor.  Yıllardır çeşitli ürünler pazarlamış,şu an yaptığı oriflame işi daha uygun ve karlı gelmiş.  Diğer işlere göre de daha kolay  pazarlandığını düşünüyor.  Çevresinin bu iş sayesinde çok genişlediğini düşünüyor.  Bu kredi ile toplu ürün alıcak.  Oriflame işinde ,zaman zaman kampanya yapılıp,birçok hediye veriliyor.  Bu hediyeleri de satabiliyorlar,böylece daha iyi para kazanıyorlar.  Gelecekte işini büyütmek  ve daha çok para kazanmak istiyor.  Gelecekte çocuklarının okullarına destek olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a construction worker.

Since the factory is far away from home, Samphors is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm, build a kitchen and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina, de 27 años de edad, convive con su pareja  Víctor de 30 años; fruto de ese amor  tienen una hija. Juntos residen su propia casa donde su mayor anhelo es salir adelante. Dina se mantiene sola desde los 21 años, su sueño era  tener su propia tienda de abarrotes, pero por cosas del destino, se dedicó a la producción y comercialización de ladrillos de manera artesanal, desde luego que no se arrepiente, ya que le está resultando buenas satisfacciones económicas. Actualmente los vende en la localidad de Pichari, ya que es una localidad que esta en constante crecimiento económico y poblacional; en efecto que ya tiene compradores potenciales, por la buena calidad y tiempo de entrega que lo ofrece a sus clientes. Normalmente ella trabaja con su pareja y juntos realizan su trabajo por salir adelante, pero siempre necesitan de sus colaboradores, para que lo puedan facilitar en producir en un tiempo menor. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma planta de elaboración; gracias a su trabajo llego a comprar un carro de carga para que pueda trasladar sus ladrillos hacia su cliente final, con el propósito de minimizar costo y tiempo. Este es crédito numero 08 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual y eficiente, además se siente satisfecho con su banco comunal, por los beneficios que otorga.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, invertirá en su ladrillería comprando materiales para la actividad que realiza.
texts.en:
27-year-old Dina lives together with her partner Víctor who is 30 years old.  The couple have one daughter.  They live together in their own home and their biggest desire is to get ahead in life.  Dina has been supporting herself since she was 21.  Her dream was to own her own grocery store but fate had other plans and she started producing and selling hand-made bricks instead.  She does not regret this, however, as the business is providing her with a lot of financial satisfaction.  She currently sells her products in the town of Pichari as this is a town which is experiencing constant growth both in financial and demographic terms.  She has potential buyers because of the good quality of her bricks and the delivery time that she offers her customers.  She generally works with her partner and they both carry out their work so that they can get ahead in life.  However, they always need workers so that they can produce their bricks in less time.  Dina sells her products directly from her production site.  Thanks to her work, she managed to buy a vehicle for transporting her bricks to her customers.  This was done to minimize costs and time.

This is Dina's eighth loan from MFP and she pledges to continue making her repayments punctually and efficiently.  She feels happy with her community bank as a result of the benefits that it offers.  Dina will invest the 2,000 soles in her brick-making business, buying materials for it.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more bricks

loans.name: Ena Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Ena del Rosario  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la realización de refresco desde hace 9 años. Este negocio lo inicio con una tía, luego con ayuda de su suegra  se independizo ya que logro comprar su carretón, baldes y materiales. El crédito lo invertirá en  insumos linaza, naranja, mandarina, piña, limones, bolsas, azúcar…etc.
texts.en:
Ena del Rosario is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has worked making soft drinks for nine years.  She started this business with an aunt.  Later, with the help of her mother-in-law, she became independent because she managed to buy her cart, pails, and equipment.

She will invest the loan in supplies: linseed, oranges, mandarins, pineapples, lemons, bags, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies: linseed, oranges, mandarins, pineapples, lemons, bags, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Karla Victoria

texts.es: Karla tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 19 años de edad, a la que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su venta de medicamentos, logra sacar adelante a su  familia, venta de que lleva a cabo desde hace 15 años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos. Karla desea invertir en su negocio de medicamentos, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar medicamentos y vitaminas para vender y cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes solicitan.

loans.use: Para comprar medicamentos y vitaminas para vender y cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes solicitan.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina H. is 44 years old. She is divorced and lives with his 19 years old boy in Kardjali. Katerina runs her own business since 1996. She has a retail business and sells perfumery, cosmetics, accessories and small jewelry. She owns two gift shops in Kardjali and in November 2005 she found s shoes shop in the near town of Ardino. All the three shops are doing well but now Katerina H. wants to make some repairs on her shop in Ardino so she applies for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: To make rapairs on her shop

loans.name: Sali

texts.en: Sali A. is 38 years old and lives in the village of Sinia voda (Blue water), near Razgrad. He is married and has two sons. Razgrad region has a very high level of unemployment and so Sali started own business. Four years ago he opens a saloon in his native village but soon he has to close it because of the poverty of village people. Later he decided to start an agricultural business. He has 8 hectares of land and rents 22 more hectares and  grows vegetables, strawberries and raspberries. Now he needs some financial help to buy plastic covers for his greenhouses. The loan amount is $1200.

loans.use: To buy plastic covers for his greenhouses

loans.name: Dilcia Lizeth

texts.en:
I've been running my small business for four years. I sell fast food, mostly burritos. My business helps me afford to educate my children and pay the bills.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo este pequeño negocio desde hace 4 años, el cual vendo comida rapida, aqui en nuestro pais se le laman burritas, las tortillas con frijles y carnes. Este negocio meda para darle los estudios a mis hijos y ayudar en el hogar con los gastos mensuales.

loans.use: Purchase meat, beans, rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en: Hermelinda comes from a fishing family. Her mom has had a fishing business for over ten years and Hermelinda just began hers around two years ago.  With the help of her loans from PRISMA she has been able to stabilize her business and find success in the local market.  She would like to use the money from a $175 loan to buy a new boat and more poles to expand her harvest.  Hermelinda and her husband spend their days together out on Lake Arapa catching fish to sell.  Meanwhile, their two children Miliana, six years-old, and Christian, eight, are just starting out in school.  Although they are too young to help with the business now, they are still able to enjoy the delicious fish their parents bring home for dinner.  With a new boat and more poles, their parents could bring home more fish to eat, and also with expanded sales, create an increased level of financial security for their future.

loans.use: Purchase a second fishing boat.

loans.name: Jamile

texts.en:
Jamile is a 39-year-old married woman, mother of 3 children, living in the village of Baalechmey in the rural area of the Chouf. Jamile specializes in crochet work and the creation of "faux-bijoux" that she usually sells in the city of Aley, not far from her village, or while participating in local exhibitions. Her husband and her daughters love to help her when they have free time.

Jamile is part of a group with other women. Group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Purchase of accessories for the handicraft work and material for the "crochet"

loans.name: O.m.m. Group

texts.pt:
The 5 women in this group are not officially married but each one of them lives with a man who has children. Elina has 3 children, Lina has 6 children, Helena has 3 children, Argentina has 7 children and Lucia has 4. The men with home these women live are not employed. They live from small jobs and the machamba (small agricultural field). And that's why these women have small businesses to contribute to the household expenses. Because otherwise, it's very difficult to ensure that the children can study.

If business goes well in the future, some of these women plan to improve their homes, while others want to save money to pay for their children's schooling, for them to continue as long as possible.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

As 5 senhoras nao sao casadas oficialmente mas cada uma delas vive com um homem com quem tem filhos.Elina tem 3 filhos,Lina tem 6 filhos, Helena tem 3 filhos, Argentina tem 7 filhos e Lucia tem 4 filhos.Os homens com os quais estas senhoras vivem nao estao empregados. Eles vivem de pequenos expedientes e fazem machamba.E por isso que estas senhoras fazem pequenos negocios para apoiar nas despesas da casa. Porque de contrario torna-se muito dificil assegurar que as criancas estudem. Se o negocio correr bem no futuro umas pensam melhorar a residencia, outras guardar dinheiro para pagar a escola dos filhos ate onde puderem estudar.

loans.use: The 5 members of the OMM Group want to use the loan money for the purchase of products for their stands at the market.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
