Mr. O. Thy (age 50) and his family live in a small village off of National Road 2, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. O. and his wife (age 47 -- see photo), have been married since 1980 and have two children. Both children have finished studying in school. One is married with two children of her own. All of them, as well as two grandparents, live at home – for a total of eight persons.

O. (pronounced “ook”) has fished since he was a young boy. His wife explained that he fishes for two to three months of the year in the Tonle Bassac (river), a tributary of the nearby Mekong. The remainder of the year he fishes in a nearby lake using locally made fish traps (again, see photo). They are requesting this, their eighth loan from Maxima, to buy a cow and fish traps. O.’s wife said a trap costs 70,000 Riel (US $17.50). She also said he can catch twenty kilos on a good day making about 50,000 Riel (US $12.50), depending on the types of fish he catches.

loans.use: To purchase one calf and buy fish traps.

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en: My name is Anwer G. Fareed, and I have lived in Borewala, a small city in Pakistan, since my marriage. Before my marriage I lived in Faisalabad, an industrial city in Pakistan.  I am a mother of six girls and three sons. My husband wants to buy a rickshaw and needs a loan for this purpose. I weave carpets at my house and earn a good income. I am a group leader of a few other women, who are: Sughran B., who plans to use her loan for her nephew to start a car spare parts shop; and Hameedan B., who needs a loan to buy a rickshaw for her son.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Edirisa

texts.en: Edirisa is 62 years old and married with 11 children and takes care of 8 grandchildren. For 42 years, he has been buying hides and skins from Uganda Meat Packers which he sells to various suppliers and exporters in Kawempe, Busega. He also buys land and houses and develops them before selling them at a higher price. He also has a welding workshop at Kireka near his home where he makes metallic doors, windows, and gates. He is our client and according to him, if it were not for his daughter’s assistance, he would have problems particularly with paper work and advice. He accords his success to his forefathers who trained him in business as he has trained his daughter. He intends to invest the loan more into his businesses.

loans.use: To buy more hides, skins, and land to boost his income.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Mrs. Khen C., 58, a widow with two children, is a farmer living in Teok Nem Village, which is located in Kandal Province. One child is enrolled in a local school, and the other works as a tailor generating an income of around $5 per day. Mrs. Khen C. relies on her children because she has no income. She now requests a loan of $525 to build a new shop for her child and to buy beauty salon equipment as well as wedding clothes to rent to people for their wedding ceremony.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon equipment and wedding clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and is married woman with 9 children, ages 33-10 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, age 85 years old. Mary owns a small shop, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $45 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Vidalina's Group

texts.es:
Vidalina, Virginia and Juana belong to the Pantipampa Communal Bank. The Pantipampa community is located two hours away from the city of Ayacucho.

Vidalina, 31 years old, lives with her partner and has five children. She has a store where she sells groceries and produce. She also buys small animals, which she fattens and sells at the community fair.

Virginia, 29 years old, also lives with her partner and has four children. She buys small animals and cattle, which she then sells at the community fair.

Juana, 34 years old, is married and has two children. She buys cereals and tubers at her community fair and sells them at the market in Ayacucho.

Vidalina, Virginia and Juana need loans for 900, 300 and 900 soles respectively. They will invest this money in the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, candies, potatoes, wheat, barley and pigs.

The dreams of Vidalina, Virginia and Juana are to buy a strip of land, improve her house and provide a good education to her children, respectively.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Vidalina, Virginia y Juana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Pantipampa, que lleva este nombre porque todas sus socias son de la comunidad de Pantipampa, ubicada a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Vidalina es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 5 hijos. Vidalina tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes y verduras. Además compra animales menores que luego beneficia y vende en la feria de su comunidad.

Por otro lado Virginia es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 4 hijos. Virginia compra animales menores y ganado vacuno, que luego vende en la feria de su comunidad.

Mientras que Juana es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos. Juana compra cereales y tubérculos en su comunidad y los vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Vidalina, Virginia y Juana necesitan préstamos de 900, 300 y 900 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, golosinas, cerdos, papa, trigo y cebada.

Los sueños de Vidalina, Virginia y Juana son comprar un terreno, mejorar su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, candies, potatoes, wheat, barley and pigs.

loans.name: Luis José

texts.es:
For16 years in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in the city of Managua Señor Luis A. has been dedicated to his vehicles workshop business in his own location where he attends very kindly to his clients that visit him in their sector. He is a very industrious gentleman that seeks the way to do well in his business, to offer better conditions for study to his three small children that need him so much.

At present, he has applied to Ceprodel to obtain the necessary loan for the improvement of his business through the purchase of tools and the improvement of the work location. For this reason he has applied to Ceprodel to obtain the loan in order to get ahead in his business that so much needs an immediate investment.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 16 años en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en la ciudad de Managua el señor Luis A. se dedica a su negocio de taller de vehículos en su propia localidad el cual atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que le visitan en su sector. El es un caballero muy esforzado que busca la manera de salir adelante en su negocio para brindarle las mejores condiciones de estudio a sus tres pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de él.

Actualmente, ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la mejora de su negocio por medio de la compra de herramientas y mejora del local de trabajo. Por esta razón es que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión inmediata.

loans.use: To buy tools for his mechanic shop and to improve his workshop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ella is 29 years old. She finished her high school education and speaks Spanish and Aymara (indigenous language). She has two sons that are studying at school. Her dwellings are located in the 24 de junio (June 24th) barrio of Villa Chipana, Pilcuyo District in the province of El Collao

Elizabeth elaborates and sells breads since 10 years ago; a product that she sells every Sunday at the Ilave fair. She belongs to the "Lago Azul" (Blue Lake) Communal Bank. She started with a S/. 300.00 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) loan that Ella invested in buying three sacks of flour. With this new loan of S/. 1,600.00 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), which she promises to pay back in 3 months, Ella will buy three sacks of flour, one sack of sugar and wood. Being part of the Communal Bank taught her to be responsible with her payments. Her biggest hope is to be able to buy a house in Puno so her children can continue to study an also she dreams of having a great bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Ella tiene 29 años de edad, culminó su estudio secundario, habla el idioma castellano y aymará, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos varones que están estudiando en la escuela. Su domicilio queda en el barrio 24 de junio de Villa Chipana, del Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao. Elizabeth se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes desde hace diez años producto que lo vende todos los domingos en la feria de Ilave. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Lago Azul” inicio con un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra de tres sacos de harina. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,600.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 3 meses, compró tres sacos de harina, un saco de azúcar y leña. Estando en el banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable en sus pagos. El gran anhelo que tiene es comprar una casa en Puno, para que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y tener un a gran panadería.

loans.use: Buying goods at wholesale(flour, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Tafrosa

texts.en: Tafrosa V. is a member of Buchwa women group in Migori Kenya. She is a 50 year old married mother of seven children. She runs a retail shop in Bware where she sells fast moving consumables mostly used by the community. She requires US $ 500 to buy more stock of consumables.

loans.use: Purchase more stock.

loans.name: Faridah's Bananas And Charcoal Group

texts.en:
Faridah is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 42 year old and married with 6 children, aged between 22 and 5 years old. Five of her children go to school and the first-born is already working. She owns and resides in a five-roomed house, living with ten people. There is electricity but no water. The family gets three meals a day.

Faridah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Faridah works seven days a week and operates her business from her home. She deals in bananas and charcoal, selling to all categories of people both wholesale and retail.

Faridah sells to an average of 40 people per day. She buys bananas and charcoal from her home and doesn't incur any extra transport costs. Faridah has been in this business for the last ten years. She first dealt in bananas only but with subsequent loans from MCDT, she was able to supplement her income by investing in the charcoal business.

Faridah has been with MCDT for the last six years and is servicing her sixteenth loan, working all this time with her same group. Her major challenge is defaulters in the charcoal business. She wants to use this loan to invest in farm produce and supply it to various nearby schools. She aspires to constructing rental houses in the free space near her home.

loans.use: to  increase her inventory and also invest in farm produce

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mrs. So O. was bO. in 1970, and she now lives in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a fish seller and her husband, Mr. Preap Pronh, helps with her business. They have five children, two of whom help their parents’ business, while another two are attending the local school. The youngest one is three years old and thus too young to work or study. Although most of Mrs. So O.'s family members have business activities, they still cannot support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. So O. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband, so he can start a new motorbike taxi business. She hopes to increase her income and better support her family with this new loan. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To help buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new motorbike taxi business

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Marta P. S. es originaria de la ciudad de Managua y labora en el mercado Israel Lewites donde se desempeña en la venta de productos de vidrio y productos para el hogar dedicándose a este negocio desde hace 16 largos años.

Hoy en día gracias al apoyo obtenido por Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su negocio ya que ha adquirido mayores cantidades de productos de vidrio y además ha mejorado su situación económica por lo que ha desarrollado su negocio. Una vez más solicita el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual adquirir los productos y comercializarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta P. S. is from the city of Managua and works in the Israel Lewites market where she sells glass and homewares, and manages very well. She has been devoted to this business for 16 long years. Today, thanks to the support of Ceprodel she has managed to improve her business as she has acquired greater quantities of glass products. She has improved her economic situation by developing her business. She is asking for help from Ceprodel once more, in order to get a loan to purchase stock and to market her business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stock

loans.name: Rolande

texts.en:
Rolande Adechina was born on May 13, 1968 in Cotonou. She is a divorced mother of one child and she has sold vegetable oil for the past 4 years in Sènadé. She is now applying for a loan to buy 10 more drums of vegetable oil. This will help her do more business and increase her income.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: To purchase of 10 drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es: Ursula tiene 51 años, es madre soltera de una hija llamada Sonia de 27 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comestibles en la tiendita escolar del colegio Claudio Galeno de la ciudad de Juliaca, obtiene muy buenas ganancias, ya que todos los niños adquieren gran cantidad de golosinas y dulces en la hora del recreo y a la hora de salida, logrando que su negocio sea muy rentable. Lo más difícil es atender a todos los niños, que presa de su entusiasmo, piden a gritos los productos que quieren comprar, pero Ursula con una gran paciencia y bondad los atiende unos uno, ya que como ella dice, son sus engreídos. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado abastecerá su tiendita escolar con más productos para abastecer la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en:
Ursula is 51 years old and a single mother. Her daughter Sonia is 27 years old. Ursula sells refreshments at the Claudio Galeno school refreshment stand in the city of Juliaca. She earns good pay since the children buy large amounts of candy and sweets at recess and after school, making the business profitable. The most difficult part is serving all the children since they get caught up in their enthusiasm and scream for the items they want to buy. Ursula serves them one by one with great patience and kindness since, as she says, they are her spoiled kids. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she has requested, she will stock her school refreshment stand with more products to meet the demands of her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran K. is 48 years old. He is married with children. He started his own business 12 years ago because his salary as a driver was not enough to meet their family's expenses. Kamran sells candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income he generates allows Kamran to support his large family, including his parents, who live with his family. Kamran dreams about providing all of his children with higher education. Today he is requesting 1200 USD for 15 months. He is going to spend the loan to expand the range of goods in his confectionery store. He is planning to spend the income to build a private store, as well as for educating her children. Kamran thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase more food in order to increase his profit

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Tous mariés, les membres du groupe Benkadi ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et de 6 enfants .Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux dans le village de Coni dans la sous préfecture de Fana dans la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, république du Mali. 
Unies par des relations familiales, elles font le ramassage des noix de karité et l’achat vente des noix de karité.
 Dans le souci de développer leurs activités génératrices de revenu, elles ont décidé intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après deux prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Les membres du groupe comptent acheter en plus de leur propre quantité ramassée,  4 tonnes de noix de karité auprès de leurs camarades de Coni pour les revendre au comptant aux grossistes venant de grandes villes telle Fana,  Ségou, Sikasso etc. Leur clientèle est composée essentiellement d’hommes.
 Avec ce prêt elles  comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 15 000 FCFA  chacune et se proposent d’utiliser ce bénéfice dans l’épanouissement de leur activité.
texts.en:
All married, the members of the Benkadi group have an average age of 33 and, on average, 6 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children and husbands, in the village of Coni, in the Sous-prefecture of Fana, Prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali.

United by ties of family, they collect "karité" nuts (out of which shea butter is made) and buy and sell those nuts. Wishing to develop their businesses, they decided to become members of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After two group loans (solidarity loans) they are on their third solidarity loan with the two preceding loans correctly reimbursed.

The members of the group intend to buy more nuts than they themselves can collect: 4 tons of karité nuts from their colleagues in Coni, to re-sell them for cash to wholesalers who come from the big towns such as Fana, Ségou, Sikasso, etc. Their clientele is composed essentially of men.

With this loan they expect to make a profit of 15,000 F CFA each and intend to use this profit to expand their business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of karité nuts for re-sale

loans.name: Cynthia Iveth

texts.es:
Cynthia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Cynthia es soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Cynthia vende papa por mayor, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Ica a donde envía sus productos con su papa, la papa lo adquiere en su puesto del mercado Las Américas.
Cynthia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Cynthia sueña con seguir ahorrando para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Cynthia is a partner of the Communal Llapanchik Bank which means “everything” in Quechua (native local language). Cynthia is single; she’s 25 years old and has one child. Cynthia sells potatoes primarily. Her sales are conducted in the city of Ica where she sends her products with her father. Her father gets a stand in the Las Americas marketplace. Cynthia needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of potatoes. Cynthia dreams of saving money to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Fedela

texts.en: Fedela A. N. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Fedela sells lining and other sewing materials and also mobile phone credit cards in Abura, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a laboratory technician. Fedela uses her income to assist her husband in paying their household expenses. Fedela will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of lining and other sewing materials as well as mobile phone credit cards to meet the increase in demand by her customers. Fedela plans to reinvest the new profits into her business.

loans.use: To expand sewing material and mobile phone credit card inventory

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
U. Olimjon is 30 years old. He is married with four children. Ever since he was young, he has been farming and raising animals. He has 4 hectares of land where he produces wheat and onions. And also he raises cattle and, little by little over time, he has been improving and expanding the business with the goal of improving his family’s standard of living and continuing to pay for his children’s school expenses.

IMON International has been a fundamental part of Olimjon´s business, having provided loans which have been used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and calves. Today, once again, Olimjon faces this need, and he trusts that his loan will be granted so that he can help his business and his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase calves in order to expand his business

loans.name: Wilium

texts.en:
Wilium G. runs two businesses, a pub and poultry keeping, in Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam.  He is a
microentreprenuer, married with a family to support. He sells varieties of drinks, both soft and alcoholic drinks. He sells also varieties of food and also keeps both broilers and layers poultry. Business income is used to meet his daily family needs and paying school fees. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: "I only have a small rice farm until it grows. My husband and I have been tilling our farm since the start of our marriage. All we want is to have an abundant harvest to be able to provide for the needs of our two dear children," says Mrs. Joan D., a 31-year-old farmer from Agusan Del Sur, Mindanao. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase seven sacks of fertilizer and pesticides as well. She thinks that by doing so, she can improve their harvest. CEVI is reaching out to a lot of poor families. It gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seven sacks of ammonium nitrate fertilizer

loans.name: Clotilda

texts.es: Clotilda tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 15 años se dedica a las actividades ganaderas y agrícolas, tiene 5 vacas, 4 ovejas y cultiva maíz y papa. Después D. varios meses D. cuidar sus productos, venD. sus cosechas a los intermediarios, que son las personas que compran las verduras directamente a los agricultores y luego las distribuyen a los comerciantes minoristas en los diferentes mercados. Clotilda también venD. sus animales en las ferias ganaderas D. su localidad, su esposo y sus hijos la ayudan a realizar ambas tareas, las cuales, muchas veces, requieren D. largas jornadas D. trabajo, pero que son compensadas con las ganancias obtenidas.Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y viene participando del trabajo en un banco comunal, por lo que se siente respaldada por sus compañeros y compañeras D. grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será utilizado en la compra D. sacos D. abono para su próxima campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Clotilda is 54 years old and lives with her husband and four children in their own home. She has worked with cattle, and in agriculture, for 15 years and has five cows and four sheep. She cultivates corn and potatoes. After caring for her products, she sells them to the intermediaries, the people who buy vegetables directly from farmers and then sell them to small business owners in different markets. Clotilda also sells her animals in the cattle fairs of her area. Her husband and children help her with all of her tasks, tasks that sometimes involve long days of work, but they are compensated with what they earn. This is her third loan with MFP and she is a member of a communal bank. She feels supported by her fellow group members. She will use the money asked for to buy sacks of fertilizer for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita F. manages a small rice field. She is a 37-year-old mother and has four children. Her husband, Rodrigo F. tills the field. They are busy as a bee making their farm productive to provide the family basic needs. Anita started farming fifteen years ago. Her farm is situated at their location. Aside form rice, she also manages a sari-sari (variety) store to supplement their income. Anita would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm needs. The loan will help her achieve a better yield on her farm. CEVI helps small business grow. It provides its clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm needs

loans.name: Jorge Richard

texts.en:
Jorge is 30 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in a rented house. He used to work for a company but has recently begun working for himself because he can make more profits this way. With the chance for increased profits, however, comes increased risk, due to maintenance issues.

There's a lot of competition in this business, as many people who don't have a formal job decide to work as a taxi driver. However Jorge has some fixed clients for whom he works, picking them up in the morning to take them to work and in the afternoon to take them home. On top of this, he works during the day searching for passengers at the local bus and airport terminals. In his words, "It's hard but doable." The money he borrowed from Agrocapital will be used to overhaul his vehicle so that he doesn't have to deal with any "surprises" and be forced to stop working. The last loan he took from Agrocapital was paid with some delays due precisely to his malfunctioning vehicle. He was quick to inform this to the credit officer. In short, Jorge is very responsible.

loans.use: Maintain his taxi

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda N. est une veuve. Elle vend des fruits de saison comme les mangues actuellement. Son objectif est d’améliorer de meilleures conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïda N. is a widow. She sells seasonal fruit, such as mangoes right now. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit in season

loans.name: Saboatjon

texts.ru: Ахмедова Сабоатчон, женщина 1967 года  рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей. Муж Сабоат водитель маршрутного такси. Она занимается пошивом женской и мужской одежды на дому и ПО «Навбахор» города Худжанда. Так же у неё много учеников, которых она учить шитью.  У Сабоат сейчас много заказов на летную одежду, поэтому она  планирует закупить летную ткань на пошив женских платьев и мужских сорочек. Она благодарна кредитором за поддержку её деятельности.
texts.en:
Saboatjon A. was born in 1967 and is married with three children. Her husband is employed as a minibus driver. Saboat is a seamstress and works on men's and women's clothing from home and for the Navbakhor company in Khujand, Tajikistan. She also has several students whom she is teaching to sew. Currently, Saboat has many orders for summer clothing, so she plans to purchase lightweight fabric for dresses and men's shirts. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Futurp Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Futuro inicia su ciclo 39 con 16 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. carne, cereales, ropa, animales menores, abarrotes en general, chicha, golosinas, artesanía, verduras, bebidas.
 	
Como es el caso D. Rufina que es casada y tiene 52 años, Rufina compra cereales D. las ferias y los comercializa en la ciudad D. Lima.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 12,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. trigo, cebada, calzados, chompas, pantalones, golosinas, carne.

Los sueños D. las socias son comprar un carro, ampliar sus negocios y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Future Communal Bank begins its 39th cycle with 16 members. The members have different businesses like selling meat, grains, clothing, small animals, groceries, chichi, candy, artisan pieces, vegetables, and beverages. Such is the case of Rufina, married and 52 years old. Rufina buys grains in the markets and sells them in Lima. The members need different loan amounts such as 600, 900, or 1000 soles, totaling 12,200 soles for the Communal Bank loan. Their loans will be invested in buying wheat, barley, shoes, sweaters, pants, candy, meat. Member dreams incluD. buying a car, expanding their businesses and having their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat, barley, shoes, sweaters, pants, candy, meat.

loans.name: Bethel Group

texts.en:
Rose sells pastries. She is 59 years old, married and has five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment the town of Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

Rose is the leader of a trust bank group called Bethel. The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities. They supply their local market and nearby communities, and sometimes trek to nearby community markets. They want a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Walter G., de 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio Healeah en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 13,15 y 17 años de edad,  y se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y otras variedades, para ayudar a sus hijos ya que los tres estudian y son muchos gastos. Don Walter fotógrafo profesional con 21 años de experiencia, de día a día sale a tomar sus fotos en diferente parte de la capital, su dificultades es que no trabaja con tecnología de punta por no tener el dinero suficiente para comprar los artefactos, ya que tiene que cubrir los gastos para su familia. Con este ciclo es su sexto  en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de  una computadora para realizar trabajo de retoque en las fotografías digital. Entre sus planes es poder seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa que por ser los materiales caro ha ido poco a poco mejorando. Agradece a la institución por el financiamiento el cual se beneficiara para lograr su trabaja y vender mejor imagen lo que atraerá mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Mr. Walter G. is 42 years old. He lives in the Healeash neighborhood of Nicaragua’s capital, Managua. He is married and he and his wife have three children ages 13, 15, and 17. His wife sells clothing, cosmetics, and various other things to help pay the bills since all their children are students, which is expensive. Mr. Walter has been a professional photographer for 21 year. He goes out daily to take pictures in various parts of the capital. His problem is that he doesn’t work with point technology since he can’t afford to buy the equipment since he has so many household bills. With his sixth loan with Afrodeni, he will purchase a computer so he can edit digital photographs. He also hopes to continue to improve his home’s infrastructure. He has been making improvements slowly since the materials are expensive. He is grateful for this financial institution that helps him to create better pictures so he can make better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer to be able to edit pictures.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheng A. lives in Cham Bork Tim village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She does not have enough money to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve the rice field. So, she decided to ask for a loan to make these purchases.

Mrs. Pheng A. is a 57-year-old widow with two children; one is a motorbike taxi driver and the other attends the local school.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve the rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock in  bulk

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: M. Amélé est née en 1974 à Lomé, capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Amélé est mariée à GLAHOU Laurent, un entrepreneur. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. C’est depuis trois ans que Amélé vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint à Cocotomey, non de loin de Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Amélé vient en aide à son mari Laurent dans les charges de la famille. Amélé n’a jamais été à l’école. Amélé a abandonné la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs fermenté) au profit de la vente de sacs de charbon de bois et de sacs de maïs à son domicile et aussi par le système de distribution. Amélé achète ses produits dans le Nord du Bénin. Amélé a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Amélé voudrait aller dans le Nord du Bénin afin de s’approvisionner en gros et d’agrandir son activité. C’est pourquoi Amélé sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Amélé M. was born in 1974 in Lomé, the capital of Togo, which borders Benin. Amélé is married to Laurent Glahou, an entrepreneur. The couple has four children who are all in school. For the past three years, Amélé has lived with her children and husband in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Amélé helps her husband Laurent handle the family's expenses. Amélé never went to school. Amélé stopped selling food items (ogi, a fermented cereal porridge) and began selling sacks of charcoal and corn at home and also through the distribution system. Amélé buys her stock in northern Benin. She has already received one loan through Alidé which she repaid in full. She is requesting a second loan through Alidé because she would like to travel to northern Benin to buy her stock wholesale and therefore improve her business

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 6 sacks of charcoal and 4 sacks of corn

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Skilled in cooking and food processing, this is the hobby of Mrs. Helen R., 40 years of age and a resident of Labuyo, Tangub City. She is married to Maximino R. Jr., a government employee. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are now of school-age.

Helen started her carinderia (eatery) ten years ago with an initial capital of only P800. She was able to sustain the business even when we experienced economic crises in the country.

Helen joined Paglaum MPC a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

With a good credit record and with capacity, she was able to obtain multiple loans. Now she is given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P8,000 to add the capital of her carinderia and to buy and sell hotdogs and milk powder.

Helen’s only dream in life is to be able to support her children especially in their education.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her carinderia and to buy hotdogs and powdered milk to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Taabu

texts.en: Elizabeth Taabu O. makes a living by owning and running a hair salon, where she provides many different kinds of treatments to repeat and referred customers who live nearby.  She has run this salon for 25 years, and has staff working for her on a commission basis.  The main challenges she faces are lack of sufficient capital and strong competition.  She has applied for a loan for KES 20,000 to buy dryers, hair products and hair pieces.  She is married and has seven children who range in age from 10 to 26 years of age, and her main hope is that they become educated and live a better life than hers.  Elizabeth is widely thought of as humble, visionary and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers, hair products and hair pieces.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet J. is a married woman with five children. She lives in Mariakani in the Coast province, where she is a tailor. Janet has been doing the tailoring business for the last 21 years. She also supplements her income by training four part-time students in tailoring for a fee.

Janet is a member of the Lenga Self Help Group and is the chairperson of the group. The group has a good credit history with KADET, a Kiva partner. This is Janet's third loan and her business has been able to expand through the KADET loans. She will use the current loan to purchase garments from Uganda for making clothes and to also purchase materials to make school uniforms. Her main customers are the people from the community around her business area and also her friends. 

Janet's dream is to expand her training class and enroll more students, that way she will be able to maximize her profits while serving the community more.

loans.use: To purchase garments from Uganda for making clothes and to also purchase materials to make school uniforms

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna S. est âgée de 43 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 3 ans et a eu à y bénéficier de 6 prêts qu'elle à bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine. Son objectif est de participer aux différentes charge familiale et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. is 43 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  For three years, she has been a member of Banc Villageois de PALENE, where she has benefited from six loans, which she managed well and repaid.  Sokhna fattens cows and sheep.  Her goal is to help cover various family expenses and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her business

loans.name: Samuel Lutomia

texts.en:
Samuel Lutomia M. is a businessman selling second-hand clothes, which he started doing in 2009 after quitting masonry.

He is age 31, married, and a father of two children. He lives in Kwirare and does his business in a nearby market called Miyanga. He buys his stock in Nairobi once a week. Samuel wants to increase his stock in order to get enough income to be able to achieve his future plan of buying a vehicle that he would use to transport his purchased goods. It is for this that he wishes to get a loan worth 10,000 KES.

loans.use: Replenishing his stock

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Fátima del Rosario R. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación en el reparto Abraham Rugama de la 12 de Septiembre, lleva 6 años con este negocio trabajando de lunes a domingo de seis de la mañana a nueve de la noche, ella utilizo el crédito para comprar mercaderia para la pulpería como: meneítos, tortillitas, jugos, gaseosas, galletas leña, productos lácteos.
Fátima R. es casada tiene 6 hijos, tres de ellos a su cargo y en edad escolar, antes de tener su negocio echaba tortillas de maíz  luchando fuertemente para el bienestar y preparación de sus hijos en el negocio por las mañanas le ayudan sus hijos o su esposo ya que ella sale a vender por las mañanas verduras con un carretón de mano en las calles de los barrios cercanas de su casa.
Tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel y ellas manifestó que se siente muy agradecida con la institución ya que le hemos ayudado bastante y ha podido salir adelante con su familia y en sus negocios
texts.en:
Fatima del Rosario Ramirez runs a store from her home in the Abraham Rugama neighbourhood. It has been six years since Fatima started her business. She works seven days a week, from 6:00 AM - 9:00 PM. Fatima will use this loan to increase her merchandise. She plans to buy cheezies, tortillas, juice, sodas, biscuits and dairy products. Fatima is married. Of her six children, three are school age, and she cares for the other three at home. Before she opened her store, she sold corn tortillas, and had to work extremely hard just to make ends meet and care for her children. Now that she has this business, her husband and children can help out in the mornings, while she sells vegetables in nearby neighbourhoods. Fatima has been working with CEPRODEL for three years, and she's grateful for their help, which has helped her look after her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying store merchandise

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion S. is from the village of Znac, Tampilisan. She is 51 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Concepcion owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Concepcion joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad Paraguari, se reunieron un grupo de mujeres con el objetivo de conformar un comité y de esa manera acceder al préstamo que ayudaría a mejorar la actividad que las mismas realizan.
El comité lleva por nombre San Roque, cuya denominación se debe al nombre del barrio al cual pertenecen, actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo con calificación excelente integrada por 19  sacrificadas señoras, quienes ponen el mayor de sus esfuerzos para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus respectivas familias. Todas las integrantes son mujeres muy luchadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
La señora Dionisia F. es una de las integrantes, la misma se dedica al negocio de ventas de productos de uso doméstico.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora, atiende su negocio y ademas realiza todas las labores de la casa, su marido es albañil y constantemente realiza trabajo de construcción y ayuda bastante también a la familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguari, a group of women met with the aim of forming a committee and thereby accessing a loan that will help improve their business activities. Their committee, San Roque is named after the neighborhood they belong to. Currently they are in the sixth cycle of excellent ratings, the group is composed of 19 women who have sacrificed a lot and put most of their effort into improving the quality of life for themselves and their families. All of the women members are fighters, who have invested their loans in their respective business activities. Mrs. Dionisia F. is one of the members, her business sells domestic household products. She is a hard worker, she tends to her business and also takes care of all the household duties, he husband is a mason and works in construction and also helps their family a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for a bakery, dairy, meats, canned goods

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba Y. fries fish to sell at Jukwa. The fish are displayed in this wooden safe because of flies to prevent food poisoning. Aba has not received any form of education. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband with the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to save the new income from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 40 year old businesslady who sells clothes and shoes as well as fruits. She has been running this business for four years and describes her business environment as favourable. She sells her wares to area residents. She hopes to become an importer of clothes and to have a well established boutique. 

Patricia is a member of a group under Faulu whose members guarantee each other's loans. She is requesting a second loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to add stocks of clothes and shoes as well as buy a table. She describes herself as a hard-working woman who is ready to achieve more. Patricia is married and is a mother of five.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes, shoes and a table

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mr. S. is a hardworking man and a determined father who has five teenage children. S., 56, earns a living by buying and selling used goods. He also collects used goods from the customer’s houses and saves up many hundreds of kilograms of used goods to recycle. 

His wife stays at home and makes desserts to sell for additional income. In addition, three of his children are employed in different occupations. Mr. S. is taking out his loan to purchase a small piece of farmland, which he will rent to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a small piece of farmland.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel O. is from the village of  Sta. Cruz, Gingoog City. He is 45 years old. Roel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Roel owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Roel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Roel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ama Fosty

texts.en:
Ama Fosty S. sells cooking utensils and plastic containers at Abura. She has received junior high education. She is a married woman with three children and her husband is a driver. She is responsible for helping her husband provide food, clothing and shelter for the family.

Ama Fosty’s loan will be used to buy extra cooking utensils and plastic containers to resell. She anticipates using the new profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils and plastic containers to sell

loans.name: Rustan Paul

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero sin hijos maneja una mototaxi amarilla de propiedad de su madre,su pareja vende en una zapateria. El destino del credito es para necesidad personal
texts.en:
The borrower is single and has no children. He drives a yellow mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that belongs to his mother. His significant other is a salesperson in a shoe store. The loan will be used for personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Pensando En El Futuro 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Georgina is the coordinator of her group, "Pensando en el Futuro" ("Thinking about the Future"). She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and four children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to educate her children and make them good people.  In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook for her family.

Georgina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for ten years, starting with some savings she had at home. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying industrial sewing machine, bedding and curtains. She will use the profits to buy school supplies, to build her business locally and in the future, to get a car and to have a successful restaurant. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because the program came to her impoverished village and she understand that this could be her answer to get a better life.  Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, bedding and curtains

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en: Altanzul B. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia in their own ger- a traditional nomadic housing tent. He began his food retailing business in 2003. In the future, Altanzul plans to expand his business and the amount and types of products he sells and increase the number of customers he attracts. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more supplements for his business and fix the stalls in where he sells the products.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and fix his stall

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita P. is from the village of Rizal. She is 54 years old, married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Merlita owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells her raised animal. In 2007, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Martha Erling

texts.es:
La joven MARTHA ERLING T. E. es empleada en una fábrica de puros en el casco urbano del municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un préstamo en Ceprodel para la realización de un examen clínico que se realizara ya que ella esta enferma y para la compra del medicamento y así mejorar su salud  rendimiento.

Una ves que ella salió de su secundaria empezó a trabaja en dicha fabrica y así tener un ingreso familiar para su sostén diario del hogar. Ella tiene aproximadamente 8 años de laborar en dicha empresa, labora desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de los días lunes a los días viernes.

Ella espera que con este crédito logre realizarse dichos exámenes y así poder comprar el tratamiento ya que sus ingresos no le permites obtener por cuenta propia el dinero completo.

Ella es soltera y tiene una hija en edad escolar, la hija aun cursa los estudios de primaria y ella es la que sufraga los gastos escolares.

Este es el crédito numero  diez que ella solicita en un periodo de 7 años y su impacto ha sido positivo ya que dichos financiamiento le han permitido comprar algunos de los útiles del hogar que ella posee.
texts.en:
MARTHA ERLING T. E. is employed by a cigar factory in greater Condega. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to pay for clinical tests that she’ll have done because she’s ill and to pay for medicines thus improving her health. When she finished secondary school she started working in the cigar factory in order to earn family income to contribute to the daily support of the household. She has been working in that firm for about 8 years. She works from 7am until 5pm Monday through Friday. She hopes the loan will make the lab tests possible so that she can buy the treatment she needs because her income is insufficient by itself to afford the total cost. She is single and has a school age daughter. Her daughter is still in elementary school and she must cover all her educational expenses. This is the 10th loan she’s had in a span of 7 years. The impact has been positive since the loans have made it possible for her to buy some of the household utensils she owns.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines and pay for an examination.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa E. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old. Marisa is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Marisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
Lum C. was born in1973, she is married to Neba Jonathan and they are blessed with five children. She lives in Ntamulung, a quarter in the city of Bamenda, which is located in North West, Cameroon.

C. has faced some challenges in life. Poverty has been her major difficulty and she has been unable to raise capital for business projects. She plans to invest this loan in an off-license business where she will buy foodstuffs, including waterfufu, eru, palm oil and other ingredients, in order to prepare different dishes such as ikwang, an African dish prepared with cocoayams. She believes the business will succeed because she is experienced and she believes her approach to customers will be captivating. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day. C. will invest her profits into her business and also use them to care for her family and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil, rice, chicken, groundnut oil and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos en la localidad de Pacanguilla del distrito de Pacanga, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Chepén, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El cría aves de corral en diversos ambientes acondicionados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la localidad en donde vive y a sus vecinos. Adicionalmente trabaja como agricultor. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia. 

Pablo desea adquirir alimento balanceado y realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales de modo que pueda criar a sus animales de mejor modo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

El ya ha tenido créditos anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 42-year-old family man who lives with his wife and two young children in the town of Pacanguilla in the Pacanga district, an area belonging to the province of Chepén and located in the region of La Libertad, which is approximately one hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Pablo raises and sells small animals. He breeds poultry in several prepared spaces at the back of his house. When the animals reach a good level of development he sells them to his neighbours and to the dealers who often visit the town where he lives. He also works as  a farmer. With the income earned from both activities he supports his family. 

Pablo would like to buy balanced feed and make some improvements to his pens to raise his animals better. He is therefore requesing a 2000 soles loan to Edpyme Alternativa.  

He has received loans from Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has proven to be responsible and on time with repayments.

loans.use: Buy balanced feed and improve feeding conditions of small animals for sale purposes.

loans.name: Magbontho Group

texts.en:
Aminata S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is age thirty-seven, married to a miner, and the couple has two children, both of whom are still attending secondary school. 

For over fifteen years now, Aminata has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), groundnuts, rice,  etc. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Aminata will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business; she will buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice to add to her current stock.  

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos G. es de Jejui - Choré, con casa propia,  tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, todos sus hijos  son mayores de edad.
       Es propietario de una despensa con 9  años de funcionamiento, tiene buena ubicación, la mayoría de los empleados de una  gran empresa cerca de su negocio  son sus clientes.

          

               Es su décima operación de créditos con esta institución, esta abonando en forma excelente sus cuotas.

                  Con el  crédito desea comprar bebidas y otras mercaderias para  su negocio, y de esa manera hacer que cresca  cada día más y esta muy agradecido por los beneficios obtenidos.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos G. is from Jejui-Choré. He is 54 years old, married, and has his own home. All of his children are grown.

Carlos is the owner of a food pantry that he has managed for nine years. It is situated in a good location. His customers mostly consist of employees who work for a large company nearby. This will be his tenth loan with Fundación Paraguaya. His payment history is excellent.

With this loan, he wants to buy beverages and other merchandise for his business. This will allow him to continue growing each day. Carlos is very grateful for the benefits he has obtained.

loans.use: Purchase beverages & other merchandise

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a widow with eight children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a firewood-selling business for over eight years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she has real estate which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanahamisi faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation incurred while transporting firewood to her place of operation.  She hopes to own a fuel-selling stall in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Jamyilakan Jumaeva's Group

texts.en:
Jamyilakan J. is 58 years old and married with two sons and a daughter. Her sons are policemen and her daughter is studying at school.  Jamyilakan lives in Tup, a small town in the Isykul region. 

Jamyilakan is a teacher and she is the leader of this group. She also breeds livestock animals for resale after fattening. She is able to earn 3,000 Soms per month. Jamyilakan will use her portion of the loan to purchase six sheep. In the future, she would like to see her children wed. 


Where did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Elwarth

texts.en:
Elwarth T. is from the town of Banga. He is married. To make a living, Elwarth owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting corn for sale. Elwarth wants to be able to provide for all his family's needs. He hopes his business will become stable.
Elwarth joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elwarth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more timber to her business

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah, 38, is married with 4 school-aged children who all attend school. She is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya where she has been farming for over 10 years. Her main product is eggs which she sells to the neighboring households and milk which she sells to the hotels around the area. 

She has requested for a loan of 70,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to improve her poultry farm and construct a dairy unit. She says that the proceeds from this loan will go a long way in educating her children and also food sustainability in the family. She says that the high cost of medication has been her greatest challenge.

loans.use: To improve her poultry farm and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. 

Raed has a long experience in car maintenance business. In 2002 he opened his own car maintenance workshop and started working in his local area. Now, he is being well known and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting $2400 loan to install a new ceiling for the store. He is aiming to develop his business so he would be able to improve his family life style.

loans.use: Install a new ceiling for the store

loans.name: Maribel Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Maribel, tiene 60 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo solamente, pues sus hijos ya están fuera del hogar formando sus propias familias,  doña Maribel posee una tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad a los vecinos y amigos cercanos, este negocio lo aprendió desde joven y hoy día lo administra junto con su esposo en un horario de 6:00am a 6:00pm. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la tienda, ya que esta comprar la necesita para abastecer el inventario de productos de mucha demanda como aceite para cocinas, pollo, pan, condimentos, bebidas, pues estos anteriores se utilizan a diario en los hogares.  Con esta inversión quiere agradar a los clientes, ampliando la línea de productos logrando así satisfacer las necesidades de estos.
Doña Maribel tiene por objetivo tener un negocio fuerte, rentable, con muchos clientes y estabilizar los ingresos para vivir cómodamente con su esposo.
texts.en:
Maribel is 60 years old and she lives in Concepcion Batres in the department of Usulutan. She lives alone with her husband because her children are grown and they have formed families of their own. Maribel has a general store, selling basic needs products to her neighbors and to her close friends. She learned this business when she was young and today she manages the business together with her husband, from 6am to 6pm. 

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her store. She needs this purchase to supplement her inventory especially for the products that are in high demand, such as cooking oil, poultry meat, bread, condiments, and drinks. These products are used on a daily basis in the home. With this investment she wants to satisfy her clients. She also wants to add to the line of products that she offers to better satisfy the needs of her clients.

Maribel’s objective is to have a strong business that is profitable and that is supported by many clients. She hopes to stabilize her income to live comfortably with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora  Lucia, la  presidenta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, producción de polainas, costura de edredones y gorros – sombreros, artesano en mantas, tejido de mantas, ayudante de minibús, artesanía en chamarra, venta de papa, venta de chuño, costura, cultivo y venta de flores.

La señora Lucia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la 
A.C. “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA”  año y medio.   La señora Lucia tiene como negocio la venta de CD`s y pollo.  El crédito le servirá para la compra de ambos productos y los podrá vender en diferentes ferias.  La ciudad de El Alto se caracteriza por contar con ferias en diferentes zonas y son nominadas por días, es así que se tiene la feria de Lunes, la feria de Martes,  y así sucesivamente, la feria más grande es la feria de Jueves y Domingo, la misma que se ubica en la  Zona 16 de Julio. La señora Lucia esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos, como su negocio requiere de llevar la mercadería a las diferentes ferias día tras día recibe la ayuda de sus hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The nonprofit “Santa Rosa de Lima” (Saint Rosa of Lima) began its third cycle with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of Germán Busch’s focal group.  It is made up of eight members and the communal association is directed by a board headed by Lucia, the president.  The businesses that the members work in are varied.  Among them we have: neighborhood store, production of leggings, sewing comforters and hats, artisan handicrafts from fabric, weaving of fabric, minibus helper, artisan blankets, selling potatoes, selling freeze dried potatoes (for soup), sewing, and growing and selling flowers.

Lucia, the president of the communal association, says that she has been a part of the nonprofit “Santa Rosa de Lima” for a year and a half.  Her business is selling CDs and chicken.  The loan will enable her to buy both products and then she can sell them in different fairs.  The city of El Alto is characterized by having fairs in different areas which are named by their day.  Thus there is a Monday Fair, a Tuesday Fair, and so on.  The largest fairs are the Thursday and Sunday Fairs which are located in the 16th of July Zone.  Lucia is married and has four children.  As her business requires her to take her merchandise to different fairs day after day, her children help her.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the training they give.

loans.use: to buy CDs and chicken.

loans.name: Ronal Cruz

texts.es: Ronal tiene 53 años, vive en la zona de achuapa con sus dos hijos menores de edad. El se dedica a la compra y venta de muebles, desde hace más de 16 años, cuenta con la ayuda de dos personas que le brindan apoyo en la elaboración de los diferentes muebles que realiza como sillas, comedores, escritorio, cómodas entre otras. Desea utilizar su crédito para la compra de pega, clavos, herramientas, maque, alcohol, tela entre otros.  Este es su primer  crédito por lo que se encuentra muy alegre con esta oportunidad. Es bastante entregado a su familia y siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Ronal, age 53, lives in the Achuapa zone with his two minor children.  He has been buying and selling furniture for over 16 years.  He has two people who help him make the different furniture he makes like chairs, dining room furniture, desks, dressers, and others.

He wishes to use the loan to buy glue, nails, tools, varnish, alcohol, fabric, and other items.  This is his first loan, and he is very happy about this opportunity.  He is very devoted to his family, and he always watches out for their well-being and their progress.

loans.use: to buy glue, nails, tools, varnish, alcohol, fabric, and other items

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 51 years old and separated, with 5 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, curls, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Roselyn has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Roselyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bright Future Employees Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Moses is the leader of Bright Future Employees Group in Kihihi. He is 36 years old and married with two children, one of whom is already in school. Moses depends largely on his salary to survive. Since he has a family to take care of, he would like a loan to support his family as well as improve the quality of his household items. 

K. is requesting a loan to pay his children’s school fees for next term and buy land for agriculture.

loans.use: to pay school fees for next term and buy land for agriculture

loans.name: Rosa Nery

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 25 años de edad, ella tiene  2 hijos a su cargo.  Vive en casa propia, su domicilio esta ubicado en el centro poblado Narihuala  de la provincia de Cata-Caos la cual es una comunidad pequeña dedicada la agricultura, producción de artesanías y la comercialización de chicha (bebida oriunda del Perú hecha de maíz).

Rosa se dedica a la venta de chicha, comidas y artesanía en su domicilio.  Esta actividad la realiza desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, realizando la venta de chicha y comida solo  2 veces a la semana y la artesanía entrega  semanalmente, conoce a la perfección el rubro y cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Rosa está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 para poder utilizarla como capital de trabajo, como la compra de insumos y acondicionamiento del negocio.  Rosa de esta manera  podrá satisfacer su demanda de clientes ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado. 

Rosa incrementará sus ventas y obtendrá mayores ingresos,  gracias a su empeño y trabajo  espera hacerse mas conocida a través de la promoción que le hagan sus clientes actuales.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25 years old and has two children in her care.  She lives in her own home which is located in Narihuala district, in Cata-Caos province.  This is a small community where people farm, produce handicrafts and sell chicha (a native Peruvian drink which is made from corn).

Rosa makes chicha, meals and handicrafts in her home.  She has been in this business for approximately five years.  She sells her chicha and meals only twice a week and delivers her handicrafts weekly.  She knows her business to perfection and has an already established customer base in her area.

Rosa is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use as working capital to buy supplies and equip her business.  In this way, Rosa will be able to meet her customer demand which has increased in recent months.

Rosa will increase her sales and make more profits thanks to her commitment and hard work.  She hopes to become better known through recommendations from her current customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'chicha' and to equip her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from the village of Sibula, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.
