Maura sells soft drinks and pigs.  She has been in this business for 5 years because she has always been keen to make sure her children pursue their studies.  Perfecta has a grocery store.  She has been in this business for 12 years and it hasn't been easy for her to support her children and family.  Both women are very responsible and they are requesting this loan to use as working capital, to buy supplies.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angel Group

texts.es:
MarceL. es socia del bancomunal angel, que inicia su 4to ciclo con 10 scoias. MarceL. tiene 29 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, L. mayor tiene 12 años y L. ultima 5 años; elL. se dedica a L. venta D. ropas como casacas, pantalones, polos y chompas, este negocio lo viene realizando desD. hace 4 meses en el centro comercial Mariscal Cáceres en un Stand que es propio, este stand lo consiguió con L. ayuda D. sus amiga ya que le hizo un traspaso del Stand.
Antes D. realizar este negocio, MarceL. se dedicaba a L. venta D. salchipollo, L. única dificultad que elL. tiene es L. poca mercadería ya que es reciente el negocio.
El préstamo que solicita lo va emplear en L. compra D. ropas D. L. estacion como pantalones y casacas.
MarceL. es socia D. FINCA Perú desD. hace 4 ciclos y lo que más le gusta D. las reuniones D. su banco comunal son las capacitaciones por que gracias a ello aprenD. más. L. meta D. MarceL. como Presidenta en este ciclo,  es que las socias sean mas cumplidas en sus pagos y en sus asistencias.
texts.en:
MarceL. is a member of the Angel community bank.  The bank is starting its 4th round with 10 members.  MarceL., 29, has 4 children who range in age from 5- to 12-years old.  She has operated a business selling clothing--jackets, trousers, shirts and sweaters--for 4 months, selling from her own stand in the Mariscal Caceres market.  She got the stand from a friend who leased it to her.  
MarceL. used to earn a living making and selling "salchipollo" (a traditional dish).  The main obstacle for her now is that she doesn't have enough merchandise to stock her clothing business because it's just getting off the ground.  
MarcelL. will use this loan to buy seasonal clothing.  Trousers and jackets, for example.  MarceL. has been a member of FINCA Peru for all 4 rounds and what she most likes about the meetings are the skills that she's learned.  Her goal, as president of the group for this round, is for all the members to be up to date with both their payments and attendance.

loans.use: compra de ropa de la estación

loans.name: Akossiwoa

texts.fr: Akossiwa a 28 ans. Elle est née à Lomé et vit à Hédzranawoe. Elle exerce la vente des assiettes et plastiques où elle tire assez de revenus. A travers son activité, elle a remboursé déjà beaucoup de crédit. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend en suite ses marchandises au marché de Hédzranawoe et compte dans cette activité près de 5 ans. Le crédit sollicité permettra d’accroitre son commerce.
texts.en: Akossiwa is 28 years old. She was born at Lomé and lives in Hédzranawoe.She has a plate and plastics store from which she makes a quite a good income. Through her business, she has already repaid several loans. She buys her stock in Ghana at Accra and at the big market in Lomé.She sells her wares at the Hédzranawoe market and has been working at this activity for about 5 years. The loan requested will permit her to enlarge her business.

loans.use: purchase of plastic goods and plates

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 31 years old, married and has 2 children. Marie Rose’s husband is a technician and they both work hard to provide for their family. Marie Rose owns a small shop where she sells hardware and spare parts for construction. This is her 10th successful month in business! 

Marie Rose has requested a loan to buy more construction supplies to sell in her store. She plans to use any profits she makes to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more hardware and construction supplies

loans.name: Jacinta Nicolasa

texts.es:
Jacinta Nicolasa C. A.  tiene 34 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con el hijo,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jacinta Nicolasa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Jacinta Nicolasa C. A.  is 34 years old.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and son.  They live in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of San Jacinto Communal Bank, which is located in the Campo Alegre precinct near Quare parish which belongs to Baba Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers growing short-season crops like corn and rice.  This work takes a great deal of time.

Jacinta Nicolasa grows corn and rice.  She buys products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa markets and sells her products in López market.

She is asking for the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  The loan will help her to meet her needs.  She faces challenges like pests, crop diseases, and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a field.

Jacinta likes to play sports.

loans.use: Farm supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa e hijos en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; de profesión sastre, pero actualmente trabaja como chofer asalariado con un minibús de su padre.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar llantas ya que las que actualmente tiene están en mal estado y para continuar trabajando necesita que estén bien.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro, y el análisis socio económico lo califican para ser sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Mr German lives in his parents' home with his wife and children in the Tembladerani zone, in the city of La Paz. He is a tailor by trade, but currently works as the paid driver of his father's minibus.

The requested loan is for the purchase of tires, as his current tires are in bad condition. In order to continue working, he needs them to be in good condition. This is his first loan from Impro, and the socio-economic analysis has concluded that he can receive a loan.

loans.use: the purchase of tires for his minibus in which he transports passengers.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa Isabel tiene dos hijos de 13 y 17 a su cargo, su actividad es la venta de ropa nueva yleña, la mayoría de sus productos los ofrece de manera ambulante ya que diariamente obtiene nuevos clientes. Inicio este medio de vida  trabajando en una zona franca con el paso del tiempo es que ha comprado más cosas y así empezar a formar este medio de vida que ahora es tan necesario. El motivo del financiamiento para comprar pantalones, shorts, faldas, y leña ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y además tiene ciertos encargos.
texts.en:
Rosa Isabel has two children aged 13 and 17 in her care.  Her business is selling new clothes and firewood.  She makes most of her sales as an itinerant street vendor and she attracts new customers every day.  She started out working in a free-trade zone.  Over time, she has bought more products to sell and she works in this field of business which is now so important to her.

Rosa Isabel is requesting this loan to buy pants, shorts, skirts and firewood since the summer season is approaching.  She also has some orders to fill.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nyakahanga Tukore Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: N. John is the leader of the Nyakahanga Tukore Group, Ntungamo. He is 57 years old and married with 8 children. John has operated a business selling agricultural produce such as beans, maize and coffee for 5 years from his store in the Ngomba trading centre. He employs two people to help him in business. John is a determined and social person, traits which have won him more customers. He is able to make a weekly profit of 200,000 UGX. John says that before a friend introduced him to produce selling, he was only selling to traders from his farm. However, he now also knows how to make more money as he also buys from other farmers. He needs a loan to be able to buy more beans and coffee for restocking.

loans.use: to buy more beans and coffee

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor  Carlos R. es un hombre trabajador, esforzado, emprendedor, buen esposo y padre de familia. El desde hace cinco años tiene un autolavado el cual inicio con un pequeño caramanchel actualmente gracias a su ardua labor y los préstamos ha ido aumentando.
R. con el crédito comprara jabón líquido, cera para auto, engrasante y algunos productos para auto que empezara a vender.
texts.en:
Carlos R. is an enterprising, hardworking man, a good husband and father.  For the last five years he has worked in his car wash that he began with a small stall.  Now, thanks to his hard work and the loans, business has increased.
R. will use this loan to buy liquid soap, car wax, lubricants, and some auto products that he will start to sell.

loans.use: Liquid soap, sponges, car wax, etc.

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es: La Sra. Abelina , es cliente nueva, esposa de un cliente antiguo quien firma como codeudor, la señora tiene un puesto de venta de carne en el mercado de la zona de Mallasilla, la señora tiene hijos que son casados, solo un hijo joven que esta bajo su cuidado, el crédito que ahora solicita es para la compra de carne de cerdo y de Pollo , el esposo es arenero, pero esta temporada solo se dedica a sacar piedras del rio, lo que le trae poco ingreso, con tal motivo la Sra. Abelina tiene que trabajar para mantener a su familia, la Sra. Es una persona muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Abelina is a new client, but is the wife of a previous client and co-signed with him. This lady has a post selling meat at the market in the Mallasilla neighborhood. She has children who are married, and only one young son still in her care. The requested loan is to purchase pork and chicken meat. Her husband does dredging work, but this season he is only removing rocks from the river, which brings in little income, so Abelina has to work to support her family. The lady is very hardworking and is grateful to the organization for the support offered.

loans.use: to purchase pork and chicken meat.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 31 años, es una trabajadora que inicio hace un año vendiendo legumbre un día los cliente del pedían más cosa que decidió abrir una pequeña tienda.

Ella empieza a labora desde las 6:00 a m a 10:00pm todo los días. Le afecta mucho la delincuencia ya que por el sector donde vive es peligroso. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar mas producto para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, cuadernos, etc. Ella en un futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y poner más adelante una papelería con la tienda y así darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and is a hardworking woman who began selling vegetables a year ago. One day, the customers wanted more things so she decided to open a small store.

She begins work at 6am and finishes at 10pm every day. The delinquency affects her a lot, as the area where she lives is dangerous. With the loan, she wants to buy more products for her store such as rice, sugar, notebooks, etc. In the future, she wants to build a cement house and set up a stationery store with the grocery store in order to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and notebooks

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael P. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old and single. To make a living, he owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling educational and learning booklets in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Michael joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of booklets and books. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more booklets and books to sell

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en: Nelsa is a young entrepreneur who lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She makes a living by running a farm which her parents gave her. Her main crop is rice, but she also runs a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as canned goods, noodles and soap. Nelsa works hard to improve her farm and increase her income, and has applied for this loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and new items to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and items to sell in a sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothing for his business.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He sells house hold consumptions like beans, rice, and sugar. Juma faces a major obstacle of high cost of transportation in his business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase two sacks beans and two sacks of sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks, beans, and two sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 6 years, Phoebe has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of opening another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, and detergents for her store. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Sra. Albina, ella es la presidenta del comité, vive en la cuidad Concepcion.
La presidenta se motivo en la idea de producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una vision de que a través del comité estarian alcanzando el progreso de cada una.
Encantadas aceptaron conformar el comité de mujeres emprendedoras, Nombrandolo COMITÉ VIRGEN DEL CARMEN. 
El comité cuenta con diez (10) miembros, donde la mayoria se dedica a pequeñas actividades desde la venta de minutas como: empanadas, marineras, butifarras, chipas, tortas, dulces  de tal manera que puedan octener mayores ingresos para sus familias. 
Solicitan el crédito para poder comprar ingredientes para los productos alimenticios que venden como ser carne, especias, huevos y demás.
Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Mrs. Albina, the president, who lives in the city of Concepción.  The president wanted to help her friends by giving them the idea that each one could progress if they formed a group.

They were all happy to establish the women entrepreneur group called "COMITÉ VIRGEN DEL CARMEN".  There are ten members and most of them have small businesses selling food items such as pies, seafood, sausages, chips, cakes, or sweets to obtain more income for their families.

They are requesting a loan to buy ingredients for their food products such as meat, spices, eggs, etc.  They all hope to be able to get ahead for their individual and community development.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as meat, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with five children between the ages of six and 21. All of her children attend school. Irene stopped her education at grade five. For the past two years, Irene has been selling used clothes at the local market. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. 

Irene is requesting a loan to purchase two sacks of used clothes to sell. In the near future, she plans to build a house and continue to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
En un pedacito de tierra, Jhon Jairo, un joven emprendedor oriundo de El Carmen de Víboral  al oriente de Antioquia tiene un espacio destinado para la cría de vacas las cuales las comercializa en el municipio. 

A sus 34 años de edad y consciente de la necesidad de ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, Jhon Jairo espera con el paso del tiempo convertirse en un ganadero reconocido de la región. 

Actualmente, este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar terneros de levante con el fin de engordarlos para obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
On a small plot of land, Jhon Jairo, a young entrepreneur from El Carmen de Viboral to the east of Antioquia, has a small space designated for the raising of cows which he sells in the municipality.

At the age of 34, aware of the need to offer his child a better quality of life, Jhon Jairo hopes to become a well-known rancher in his region, with time.

Currently, this entrepreneur needs a loan for the purchase of calves for raising with the goal of fattening them to obtain a good income.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening.

loans.name: Chriss

texts.es: Chriss, de 28 años, está casada con Ángel. Ambos tienen una hermosa hija, Angelis, de dos años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo arduo en el sembrío, abonamiento y cosecha, es el compromiso que asumió Chriss hace 9 años; pues según afirma desde muy niña, gusto del campo y producir la tierra, ahora ella tiene más de 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra plátanos a gran escala, los cuales cosecha 2 veces al mes. Lo que más le gusta a Chriss, es poder negociar sus ricos plátanos por medio de los intermediarios, los cuales gustosos le aconsejas nuevos mercados donde ella puede expandirse y poder ofrecer sus frutos. Por ello más adelante desea convertirse en una agricultora reconocida. Ya dio su primer paso, sembrando café que espera, le brinden frutos el próximo año. Además de emprender un negocio propio en asociación de hermana; sus planes son vender ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños. Don está segura le irá muy bien. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera salir adelante junto a su banco comunal que constan de personas comprometidas con el progreso. Razón por la que se compromete en ser puntual con las cuotas. Chriss de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para fortalecer el crecimiento de sus viveros de café y la parte sobrante en sus cultivos de café que están en pleno crecimiento.
texts.en:
Criss, 28, is married to Ángel.  They have a beautiful, two-year-old daughter, Angelis, together.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Unión Popular (Peruvian Central Jungle).  

Nine years ago Criss took on the commitment to hard work planting, fertilizing and harvesting because she affirms that ever since she was a little girl she enjoyed the countryside and making the soil productive.  Now, she has more than 2 hectares of farmland where she grows bananas in large scale that are harvested twice a month.  What Criss likes best is negotiating her delicious bananas with middlemen who gladly advise her about new markets that she can expand into and sell her fruit.  Because of this, she’d like to become a well-known farmer in the future.  She’s taken the first step toward this by planting coffee that she hopes will produce a good harvest next year.  She’s also started a business of her own in partnership with her sister: selling clothes for men, women and children where she’s sure she’ll do very well.

She’s a member of the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza del Palomar” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where she hopes to succeed with her communal bank which is composed of people committed to progress and which is the motivation for her to be punctual with her payments.

If Criss were to get your support, she’ll use the requested money to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to strengthen her coffee nursery and whatever’s left over for her coffee plants which are in full growth phase.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Alnie

texts.en:
Alnie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Alnie has been in this business for eight years. Alnie earns more income from services (manicure & pedicure).

Alnie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Zurakan's Group

texts.en:
Zurakan is the treasurer of this group. She is 49 years old and unfortunately is a widow. She has raised five children, all of whom are employed. 

Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Zurakan started to sell fruits and vegetables at the market. The retail trade of fruits and vegetables brings her enough money to meet her daily needs. She applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to increase the commodity turnover for her business. With the money received from the loan, Zurakan will purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, with the profits gained from the business she plans to purchase a container. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a  28 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last 4 years, he has been operating a boutique to make a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

He is requesting for a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy trousers and jackets. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he can access business loans easily.

loans.use: To buy trousers and jackets

loans.name: Ri

texts.en: Ri sells cake, eggs, shampoo, soap, etc. She is 29 years old with two children. Her youngest son is still in school. She started her grocery store five years ago. She also raises pigs on the side. This is her first loan with VisionFund. With this loan, she hopes to increase her daily income from the grocery store, to raise more pigs, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to increase her grocery stock.

loans.name: Martha Aryera

texts.es: La señora Martha, es habitante del municipio de Veracruz, junto a su esposo e hijos, los cuales necesitan de su apoyo, su esposo labora actualmente como comerciante, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos durante el tiempo que lleva realizando esta laborar las ganancias no son muy buenas para comprar materiales de construcción; ya que ella quiere que comprar cemento, arena, piedrín, bloques , entre otras cosas para terminar de hacer el muro de su vivienda ya que tiene quiere privacidad .Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo para poder cumplir sus metas y proyecto .
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is a resident of the town of Veracruz. She lives with her husband and children who need her support. Her husband currently works as a merchant. Her plans for her family include improving their living conditions. Doña Martha sells clothing and shoes. Throughout the entire time she has been working, her earnings have not been good enough to buy construction materials. She wants to buy cement, sand, gravel, blocks, and other supplies so that she can finish building a wall around her home to provide privacy.

Martha is grateful for the funds provided by AFODENIC so that she can accomplish her goals and complete this project.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a privacy wall around her home.
